title: Part 1: Can we keep our differences aside & save our ONLY home?
body:
I am writing this today from the trenches, it has been a 5 year long journey, down a tunnel to rebuild this world, many called us too ambitious, told this is too big a challenge.

## Fighting climate change ? You will need an army for that.

Yes, this army is what we seek, band of brothers & sisters. The army of the planet filled with Earthlings - all colors, skin, culture and beliefs. We as a *race* are at a turning point. **Humanity as we know will endure pain in billions in the next 3 decades and beyond if we do not act.**

## We need to Act.

Consider this a rally call.

Keep differences aside for a while and save this home we have created on Earth. Make no mistake Earth will endure this, it is Us the stewards who will be replaced. I do not want this to be my ending, not the ending of my children.

I know it is the same for all of you as well. From one human heart to all the other human hearts reading this. Are we all that different? Donâ€™t we all want the same things?

To be happy, to be loved by friends and family. To enjoy this life and everything it has to offer - nice air to breathe, good water to drink, food to eat and pets to love. If this is all, what we all seek for the most part - why are we all so hell bent on robbing it from one another?

Our planet has **enough** for all of us, only, only if we change a few things that **we do**.For a species, We humans have gone to the moon, send robots to Mars, for such magical creatures like us, a small course correction is not going to be hard. It is possible!

When is it possible?

**When we keep our differences apart**. All of us have wronged each other. I have wronged so many wonderful people in my life, some knowingly and some unknowingly.

## I am sorry for each and every one of you. All 8 Billion of you.

Our ancestors have killed each other, robbed and cheated each other. We have done the same. Scores cannot be settled. Covid-19 first and now Climate Change is reminding us that what happens in one part of the world has an impact on the other.

Can we all have a dialogue?  
 We all see the climate change, our waters drying & our food getting scarce.

## Can we do a course correction? Can we keep our difference aside, and save our home?

It is time to pen down everything I have endured, learned and solved along with thousands driven just like me, we are in the trenches and we need Help.

**Help us course correct, it begins with the courage to say, the courage to say that 8 Billion self actualized humans at the same time collaborating is possible. Think about the progress and prosperity we can build.**

We have a whole universe out there, for the *explorers* among us to venture into, and a loving planet for those in us who want to *nurture*.

Let us make the Internet era, go down in the history as the age where humanity for the first time realized, how small a band of 8 Billion we humans are. There are over 200 Billion planets out there in the universe, compared to that how small is 8 Billion humans? We are special & rare, let us treat each other like that.

End of the day, what do we all want our legacy to be? Do we course correct to build a golden age of co-operation or will we go down as fossil fuel, made from our own bickering? 

This is a rally call brothers & sisters, from the trenches. 

We need you.

title: Bamboo Building
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1K90Iz-l3gNtN_iH-MBRH.png?height=266&width=438)

After thinking about a place for a long time, I have a vague feeling of pain, as if it was a Dai village in my previous life, which I have been dreaming about. That is the place where I used to work and live for eight years. A soft care.

The mountain wind blows the morning mist, like strips of white satin, gently and slowly, wrapping the scattered villages with a thin layer of soft yarn. The bamboo buildings with unique style and unique style are hidden by big banyan trees, mango orchards and coconut groves by the side of the village. When you look around, everything here is dyed emerald green.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/t1c6DXM1QLLBdplrVws3R.png?height=270&width=402)

Kapok on the edge of the village, with open arms, blooming with red buds, can't wait for the foil of green leaves to ignite the passion. Amorous peach blossoms, like pink clouds, are printed and dyed among the green trees, like the blush on the face of a shy girl, adding a bit of tenderness. The paddy field stretches out to the side of the mountain, blooming among the bamboo trees, and sketching among the paddy fields. The rice fields in spring are even more fascinating. When the industrious children of the Dai people plant the seedlings on the side of the mountain, they also endow the rice fields with extra beauty. The scattered rice fields are filled with clear mountain springs, such as the magic mirror scattered among the mountains of Ailao, reflecting the colorful clouds, splendid rainbows, everything in the world, and the most beautiful scenery in the world. The sun shines on the water, emitting sparkling waves. The vast tranquility and tranquility, the same mottled and overflowing reflection, is like a landscape painting, supporting a thick and dignified line of blue sky. Relying on diligence and intelligence, the Dai family has created a splendid imprint of civilization here. Pieces of rice fields connect the Dai villages, mountains and nature so harmoniously.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vgdMnAdP2COSuiS-pmgpS.png?height=266&width=414)

Stepping on the bamboo bridge, bypassing the water-filled stream, I was immersed in an ancient dream. There was a mist of rain in the sky, only the sound of the rain falling on the bananas, and only the light raindrops fell on the newly-haired green leaves and safflower, which made the natural green and red look so delicate. The drizzle was lingering, and the whole village was moistened. The green rain and fog lingered like a thin white veil, covering the strangeness of the village, but it also added a bit of mystery to the original beautiful scenery.

Standing on the bamboo building paved by Miba, the greenery of Bazi came to his eyes. Coconut groves are chasing green clouds, sugar cane overflows with mellow sweetness, and tea leaves are fragrant and intoxicating everywhere. There are dense greens everywhere, and green tides everywhere. Looking at the sky and the earth, occasionally a shadow of the mountains is revealed. Among the green waves, the big banyan trees that cover the ground, the verdant phoenix-tailed bamboos, and the fruit-bearing betel nut all decorate the charming Dai bamboo buildings.

Flowing quietly through the small river between the bamboo buildings, slapping the eternal dream of the bamboo buildings. The stockade was quiet. In the depths of the bamboo forest, a girl from the Dai family walked by carrying water, and her long tube skirt swayed with Ana's body. Dai girls are demons made of water, and water is the soul of the Dai family. The bamboo building is accompanied by water, and the sound of the spring is ding-dong, adding a kind of leisure, a kind of elegance, a kind of calm, not to mention the water here, and the bamboo building. Natural harmony, simple and beautiful bamboo building, inherits the gentleness of water and the eternity of spring!

The fragrance of dendrobium flowers fills the bamboo building, the cactus fence is full of flowers, the phoenix-tailed bamboo is rustling, the mango can be touched, and the grapefruit that bends the branches is beating against the eaves of the bamboo building. Walking into the bamboo building, the gentle and watery Dai girl will come slowly, bring a cup of glutinous rice fragrant tea, gently put the tea down, and then smile. The colorful tube skirt, the fragrant breath, the faint tea fragrance, and the sweet smile, like a dancing peacock. Walking into the quiet and peaceful bamboo building, you will have the feeling of past life and present life. This feeling, as if traveling through the ancient time and space, waiting for thousands of years, fluttering in the heart.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2Z5BWaIQexkgD6shdN8pR.png?height=266&width=463)

The sunset is gradually melted away by the green, and the sunset is dressed in a light green and beautiful wedding, slowly pulling the full moon behind the mountain. Cicada Feather's moonlight slides from the roof to the balcony. The tall banana leaves slowly hold up Haoyue, the moon in Dai Village, savoring the green night sky, and feeling the vicissitudes of time. The rain forest is soft and moist, the coconut trees are slim, and the phoenix tails and bamboos are affectionate. Sitting on the balcony paved by Zhuba, the laughter washed away the exhaustion. At this time, the bamboo building is full of warmth, auspiciousness and happiness.

In the aroma of tea, the moonlight comes from the branches and leaves, and diffuses into the lake of people's hearts. The gurgling water in the bamboo forest, now reflected in the moonlight, looks particularly cool. The breeze is coming, and the night sky is filled with fragrant fragrance, which makes people excited, and the feeling of a lifetime is suddenly lifted. In the verdant phoenix-tailed bamboo forest in front of the bamboo building, Xiaobu's long and affectionate singing, accompanied by the chirping of insects, drifted far and far with the evening wind.

The gentle singing, flowing with the breath of the Dai family, is soft and soft, like a hand plucking your heartstrings, the original Dai family charm will always be lingering in my heart. At this time, the moon became charming and beautiful, and the Dai girl who was bathing by the river felt comfortable, shy, and laughter with silver bells. The brisk drum beats and the melodious sound of gongs flew to my ears. The girl from the Dai family who followed the sound walked towards the boy who was like a madman, dancing lightly on the moon, singing flowing water. The girls looked at their lover with honey-flowing eyes, and colorful sunlight flashed in their eyes. Shuangshuang hides under the big banyan tree, or sits in the banana bush, the flowers are fragrant, the moonlight is melting, and the two loving hearts turn into thousands of words to pour out their hearts. With a little relief, the bamboo building in the wind is slowly intoxicated.

The bamboo building under the moonlight is extraordinarily enchanting, and this bamboo building is an eternal witness. It reflects the tenderness and the vicissitudes of life. On such a moonlit night, sitting quietly in front of the window of the bamboo building, the night wind blows the bamboo forest, The moonlight and the singing meet, and at this time, there is a quiet mood, which dissolves in the emotion of life like a dream.

The bamboo building under the moonlight and the bamboo building in the wind have also become my soft concern. The moon is still full of fantasy, people have been separated by thousands of mountains and rivers, but the same deep thoughts.

title: #Winning
body:
This week I had planned to write on the topic of doxing, or more specifically, about the question of â€œto dox or not to doxâ€, and the choice for, or against, web3 anonymity. As inspired as I initially felt to explore it, once I sat down to outline it the work began to feel like a grind. Then, as I often do these days when feeling stuck, I turned my attention to twitter for a daily download of crypto news and DAOist musings. Somewhere in my feed, from someone I had never heard of, there appeared the following,

â€œYou are the average of the 5 people you spend the most time with.
Thatâ€™s why every quarter, I evaluate myself and my friends on 3 key criteria:

* Income
* Fitness
* Influence

Anyone who scores below me is cut off.
Complacency is the first step towards mediocrity.â€

A day later, though I donâ€™t recall all the details of my reaction, I think it a safe bet it included some combination of a furrowed brow, my best [gas face](https://gfycat.com/decimalreasonableanophelesmosquito) and nausea.  All of that before I fired back with the first thing to come to mind as a counter blow.

â€œCongratulations on a life devoid of either giving or receiving unconditional love. Youâ€™re winning though. ğŸ‘Šâ€

[https://twitter.com/HAshBrown_27/status/1548437771974348801?s=20&t=4QqD9qeeewCOpN7zYUJ16g](https://twitter.com/HAshBrown_27/status/1548437771974348801?s=20&t=4QqD9qeeewCOpN7zYUJ16g)

Soon after that I turned off my computer and went out for the day. Honestly, I donâ€™t think it occurred to me that I would even look at the tweet again. To the contrary, as someone new to twitter this year, I expected my response would go largely ignored, joining my 20-or-so other tweets in the land of twitter oblivion. To my surprise though, when I returned home several hours later, I noticed my twitter notification bell ringing, alerting me to the fact that my response had close to 200 likes. 20 hours later that number is now up to 488. Not that Iâ€™m counting.

Iâ€™m new to this twitter thing, and as far as â€œlikesâ€ are concerned, have only facebook likes of posts of my kids, mountain views and fishing pictures to compare it to. 488 likes seems like a lot though. So while it may be small potatoes to seasoned tweeters with big followings, Iâ€™m a babe in the woods here, feeling pretty proud of that 488 thank you very much. Ooh, lookie there, just shot past 500. Am I going viral? LFG!!!

Seriously though, upon looking into the phenomena of my most-liked social media entry ever, I see the person I responded to has a lot of followers. 6,075 to be exact. And digging a little deeper I realize he likely intended his tweet as satire. Gas face rescinded. Perhaps the joke is on me for responding to it.

Satire or not, and irrespective of whether his friendship circles have anything to do with crypto and Web3, [@_mihir](https://twitter.com/__mihir?s=20&t=iOpvhasWZtEkPYiiXfkDYw) points to something very concerning to me about Web3 culture and the playing field of web3 identity. Playas gonna play. So how will Web3 define winning?

Before we get into all that I sense some context would be helpful.  A man in my early 50â€™s, I am at most a social media dabbler. I have a facebook page that I post on occasionally and to keep up with the lives of my 926 friends. I have created a few blogs over the years that I have enjoyed writing on but never broadcasted. Instagram? Ohhh hellll noâ€¦.except to check in on the lives of my college-age children. I regard the notion of creating a web â€œidentityâ€ as near hostile to my bias for real-life interaction with others and time outdoors. And other than a short list of physical ailments, I canâ€™t think of anything Iâ€™d like less than â€œfollowersâ€.

So what am I doing here worrying and writing about Web3 culture?  Fair question. What can I say except [orange pills](https://ryanslot.substack.com/p/what-it-means-to-be-orange-pilled#details) are a thing. [Green pills](https://www.forbes.com/sites/kylewestaway/2022/06/16/how-crypto-can-regenerate-the-world/?sh=7ed83b602fd3) too. Iâ€™ve fallen down a [crypto rabbit hole](https://garywoodfine.com/going-down-the-crypto-rabbit-hole/) and I canâ€™t get up!

The truth is that while I wrestle with mixed emotions about getting involved, I am thankful for cryptoâ€™s role in opening my mind (ğŸ¤¯) and luring me beyond my comfort zone.  For every horror story of greed, theft and exploitation related to this new frontier, I find most of what I read about the space to be inspiring.  To quote the immortal words of Buffalo Springfield, [â€œSomethings Happening Hereâ€](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rQUj56sqicU), 2020â€™s style, and most days I want to be a part of it.

One example of this is an article, [â€œThe Future of Workâ€](https://newsletter.banklesshq.com/p/the-future-of-work), by David Hoffman. David makes a strong case for why Digital Organizations (DOâ€™s), enabled by the blockchain and tokenized incentives, will present unprecedented opportunities for humans to coordinate both our heartsâ€™ and mindsâ€™ shared interests to do purposeful work together.  Among the many lines to strike a chord with me David writes,

â€œIf you are a young person, looking for purpose, meaning, and eventually a salary, establishing yourself as a strong DOer is one of the best footholds you can establish for yourselfâ€¦.If you believe DOs are the future, you should start DOing now, so that you become the scarce resource for both DOs and people who need help DOing.â€

Relative to the audience David likely had in mind I am not a â€œyoung personâ€. That said, aside from a rather curmudgeonly attitude toward social media, I pride myself at being young in spirit. I am DOing (and DAOing) now and, in time, aspire to be among the scarce, most valued resources of the space. So what game am I playing? And what was it about @_mihirâ€s tweet that bothered me so?

Though it has been over 20 years since I worked as an equity analyst at an investment brokerage firm, that work, and my short time in the industry, taught me some valuable lessons. The most memorable of them is the difference between the â€œgameâ€ of judging companiesâ€™ worth on the basis of quarterly performance vs. that of valuing them (or not) on the basis of fundamental strengths relative to longer-term investment horizons. The former game is played to generate transactions that pay brokers and their firms. The latter is played to maximize investorsâ€™ returns.

Web3 playing fields, DOs and DAOs included, will create whole new worlds from which to relate to the earth, token projects, and one another. There will be more games to go around than anyone can count in the spaceâ€™s many arenas. Short-term trading, of crypto and people, can be fun, even profitable. Patient investment, in the people and projects that mean the most to us, can change the world. Web3 only wins by changing the world.

title: The Market Rebounds: Has Cryptocurrency Become Bullish?
body:
As of July 15, the Crypto Fear & Greed Index shows that the market has been suffering from â€œExtreme Fearâ€ for 70 consecutive days, a record high. Although it seems thatÂ the market hasnâ€™t been so volatile in July, it remains fundamentally bearish, and the bankruptcy of top institutions did create negative market sentiments. To date, U.S. CPI soared 9.1% over the past year, the largest increase since November 1981, and global finance continues to suffer from a liquidity crunch.

As the market has just gone through a deleveraging campaign with far-reaching implications, cryptos like BTC and ETH fell below their price peaks recorded during the last market cycle. However, the market has gradually absorbed the panic impact, and there have been signs of a market rebound. According to CoinEx, a crypto exchange, the BTC price recently returned to over $22,000.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wO0DXmTsUAKNaHSAkyGT1.png?height=493&width=1280)

ETH, on the other hand, hit $1,500. It should be noted that in the last bear-bull cycle, the market recovery was also driven by increases in the ETH price.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pTfoKMP028yH3ONXF9OmN.png?height=507&width=1280)

As Bitcoin and Ethereum record consecutive price growths, DeFi tokens have also become more valuable. Does this mean that a new market cycle has started? Letâ€™s take a closer look at the current market in terms of active addresses, the inflow/outflow of money, and market fundamentals. As BTC and ETH led market recoveries during previous cycles, we will examine the relevant statistics of the two.

According to on-chain data, Bitcoinâ€™s active addresses increased by 2.44% in the past seven days, and the number of zero balance addresses went up by 5.92%.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qGACWxcZH4ubCgSuSoqnl.png?height=527&width=1280)

Ethereumâ€™s active addresses, on the other hand, grew by 9.98% in the past seven days, and the number of zero balance addresses went down by 3.05%. Meanwhile, on July 18, the number of addresses holding at least 1 ETH hit 1,554,716, an all-time high.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xVu3CIbRttcxPnZ3jXvgj.png?height=534&width=1280)

In terms of the inflow/outflow of money, although both BTC and ETH come with positive inflows, the latter shows stronger momentum.

![Historical In/Out of the Money (BTC)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9B4p_KL-8i1dvFntL68A_.png?height=544&width=1280)

![Historical In/Out of the Money (ETH)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ci0w-pAbJvUOsAgSoHPJa.png?height=585&width=1280)

Based on the current round of price growth, Ethereum has indeed outperformed Bitcoin. It is reported that Bitcoinâ€™s third largest whale has made multiple outgoing transfers since the early morning of July 19. As of this writing, the address has transferred 15,500 bitcoins that are worth about $350 million.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AEqqYQBILotqfncKuiF5N.png?height=172&width=1280)

Letâ€™s now turn to the fundamentals. As global finance faces a liquidity crunch, the crypto market hasnâ€™t been able to stay intact. The market panicked when crypto companies collapsed one after another a while back. However, the deleveraging caused by the liquidity crisis has also optimized the internal capital structure of the market and excluded more hot money. At the same time, new institutional investors are making a push into cryptocurrency.

According to the information disclosed so far, 40 fundraisings happened last week, and a16z and Sequoia Capital both took action. In particular, the scale of these fundraisings was small, with only three projects raising over $50 million. A report by The Block Research shows that the amount of VC investment in the blockchain space has declined for the first time since Q2 2020. The figure stood at $9.8 billion in Q2 2022, down by approximately 22% compared with the last quarter. Although the market is picking up strength, the fundraising statistics show that institutions remain extremely prudent.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VDDIY_rhEEBTx9wi03K3f.png?height=720&width=1079)

Any industry that seeks growth must go through multiple market cycles. From 2000 to 2002, the dot.com bubble triggered a bear market due to excessive valuations and speculations, but this did not affect its subsequent growth. Todayâ€™s crypto market is just the same. The momentary setbacks will help it find better growth drivers in the future.

As the crypto industry advances, all kinds of new functions and categories have emerged. Meanwhile, the entry threshold has kept going up, which has discouraged many who hope to join the crypto market. While everyone in the crypto space is working on more new functions, one exchange called CoinEx is striving to â€œslim downâ€ its products. To impress the world with the efforts made by the crypto market, the team is making many complex projects and tools more user-friendly. The exchange intends to make crypto trading easier and welcome investors from all sectors to the crypto space.

Todayâ€™s cryptocurrency, like the Internet, exists to make the world a better place.

title: The Market Rebounds: Has Cryptocurrency Become Bullish?
body:
As of July 15, the Crypto Fear & Greed Index shows that the market has been suffering from â€œExtreme Fearâ€ for 70 consecutive days, a record high. Although it seems thatÂ the market hasnâ€™t been so volatile in July, it remains fundamentally bearish, and the bankruptcy of top institutions did create negative market sentiments. To date, U.S. CPI soared 9.1% over the past year, the largest increase since November 1981, and global finance continues to suffer from a liquidity crunch.

As the market has just gone through a deleveraging campaign with far-reaching implications, cryptos like BTC and ETH fell below their price peaks recorded during the last market cycle. However, the market has gradually absorbed the panic impact, and there have been signs of a market rebound. According to CoinEx, a crypto exchange, the BTC price recently returned to over $22,000.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wO0DXmTsUAKNaHSAkyGT1.png?height=493&width=1280)

ETH, on the other hand, hit $1,500. It should be noted that in the last bear-bull cycle, the market recovery was also driven by increases in the ETH price.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pTfoKMP028yH3ONXF9OmN.png?height=507&width=1280)

As Bitcoin and Ethereum record consecutive price growths, DeFi tokens have also become more valuable. Does this mean that a new market cycle has started? Letâ€™s take a closer look at the current market in terms of active addresses, the inflow/outflow of money, and market fundamentals. As BTC and ETH led market recoveries during previous cycles, we will examine the relevant statistics of the two.

According to on-chain data, Bitcoinâ€™s active addresses increased by 2.44% in the past seven days, and the number of zero balance addresses went up by 5.92%.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qGACWxcZH4ubCgSuSoqnl.png?height=527&width=1280)

Ethereumâ€™s active addresses, on the other hand, grew by 9.98% in the past seven days, and the number of zero balance addresses went down by 3.05%. Meanwhile, on July 18, the number of addresses holding at least 1 ETH hit 1,554,716, an all-time high.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xVu3CIbRttcxPnZ3jXvgj.png?height=534&width=1280)

In terms of the inflow/outflow of money, although both BTC and ETH come with positive inflows, the latter shows stronger momentum.

![Historical In/Out of the Money (BTC)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9B4p_KL-8i1dvFntL68A_.png?height=544&width=1280)

![Historical In/Out of the Money (ETH)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ci0w-pAbJvUOsAgSoHPJa.png?height=585&width=1280)

Based on the current round of price growth, Ethereum has indeed outperformed Bitcoin. It is reported that Bitcoinâ€™s third largest whale has made multiple outgoing transfers since the early morning of July 19. As of this writing, the address has transferred 15,500 bitcoins that are worth about $350 million.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AEqqYQBILotqfncKuiF5N.png?height=172&width=1280)

Letâ€™s now turn to the fundamentals. As global finance faces a liquidity crunch, the crypto market hasnâ€™t been able to stay intact. The market panicked when crypto companies collapsed one after another a while back. However, the deleveraging caused by the liquidity crisis has also optimized the internal capital structure of the market and excluded more hot money. At the same time, new institutional investors are making a push into cryptocurrency.

According to the information disclosed so far, 40 fundraisings happened last week, and a16z and Sequoia Capital both took action. In particular, the scale of these fundraisings was small, with only three projects raising over $50 million. A report by The Block Research shows that the amount of VC investment in the blockchain space has declined for the first time since Q2 2020. The figure stood at $9.8 billion in Q2 2022, down by approximately 22% compared with the last quarter. Although the market is picking up strength, the fundraising statistics show that institutions remain extremely prudent.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VDDIY_rhEEBTx9wi03K3f.png?height=720&width=1079)

Any industry that seeks growth must go through multiple market cycles. From 2000 to 2002, the dot.com bubble triggered a bear market due to excessive valuations and speculations, but this did not affect its subsequent growth. Todayâ€™s crypto market is just the same. The momentary setbacks will help it find better growth drivers in the future.

As the crypto industry advances, all kinds of new functions and categories have emerged. Meanwhile, the entry threshold has kept going up, which has discouraged many who hope to join the crypto market. While everyone in the crypto space is working on more new functions, one exchange called CoinEx is striving to â€œslim downâ€ its products. To impress the world with the efforts made by the crypto market, the team is making many complex projects and tools more user-friendly. The exchange intends to make crypto trading easier and welcome investors from all sectors to the crypto space.

Todayâ€™s cryptocurrency, like the Internet, exists to make the world a better place.

title: HashKey DID Cooperates with OneCash on KYA
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/KGyD27cxYSrd4MQDU7rpG.png?height=512&width=1024)

Asian Leading compliant stablecoin provider **OneCash** has pragmatically become the first KYC Provider of Web3 identifier **HashKey DID**, to collaborate on on-chain compliance issues, and to do Know Your Address(KYA) verification for payment addresses.

**About HashKey DID**

HashKey DID is a decentralized storage-featured Web 3.0 identifier that is underpinned by NFT- and smart contract-based privacy-preserving technology. As an important Web3 infrastructure of the HashKey ecosystem, the fundamental goal of HashKey DID is to build a community-governed HashKey DID DAO together with users.

**About OneCash**

OneCash is a stablecoin centered global financial technology platform that emphasizes compliance, security, and efficiency. We envision the world of fiat and cryptos would integrate seamlessly, and endeavor to create a world where cross-border trades can be effectively settled at low or no cost.

title: The snow in the northern country
body:
Most of the snow is fluttering in the Northland. To be precise, snow is a unique sight in the Northland in winter.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kIW8P9VHJJ-yW3jJtJpV_.png?height=266&width=448)

The snow in the northern country comes very early, and sometimes the snow can't wait to come as soon as the footsteps of autumn are firm. The snow at this time is generally very small and sporadic. Although people have not enjoyed the joy of the autumn harvest, they will not be annoyed by the snow that arrives early. After all, the northerners love snow.

The posture of the snowflakes flying is admirable. You see, the snowflakes are dancing gracefully in the air. The light dance is so graceful and unrestrained, who would not say it is beautiful. When the snow falls for a few hours, the little snowflakes are like stars in the sky. It is best to float such snow at night. Looking at the snow under the street lights from a distance, you will be amazed at how there is such a spectacular meteor shower. When the snow is heavy, people like it even more. The fluttering snowflakes are like white lotus petals and goose feathers. Some people compare it to a jade butterfly. The dancing posture is really similar. Some people likened it to white plum blossoms, "Snow is like plum blossoms, and plum blossoms are like snow. It's amazing whether it looks like it or not."

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Vqle_1cjJwtj-J5qrVK1x.png?height=266&width=473)

The most beautiful moment under the snow is still in the spring and March. The spring in the northern country is like a shy little girl. It is always late. There are no flowers and no grass. "Bai Xue thinks that the spring is late, so it wears the trees to make flying flowers." In the spring, the snow is generally heavy, and in an instant, everywhere is bright white, and the dead branches are suddenly decorated by snowflakes into trees full of white flowers. Just as the poem describes, "Suddenly the spring breeze comes in one night, thousands of trees and pears bloom." Children also love the snow at this time. The snow in spring is soft, snowmen are easy to form, and snowballs will roll very well. very big. The weather at this time is also much warmer than the winter, and it will be more enjoyable to play than the winter when you can't reach out. Those who like photography will not let go of this gratifying snow scene at this time, focus on each beautiful picture, and carve it into eternity.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/77fUjUyOayAYxbgmYeKYr.png?height=266&width=474)

I not only like the dance of snowflakes, but also its color. The whiteness of snow is unmatched by other whites, the whiteness of white clouds is not clear enough, the whiteness of catkins is slightly darker, and the whiteness of various white flowers is not eye-catching enough. I think only snow is worthy of the word "white". Under the sunlight, it is dazzling and white.

I think the northerners love snow not only because of the beauty of the snow, but also because of the spirit of not being afraid of the cold. Come". Can you say that northerners don't love snow?

body:
Brief Intrduction:

1. Olandbox Blue Soul is a functional development based on the original land mint of olandbox. As a linktree in the web3 world, it currently has the functions of personal information integration and link aggregation, and will open more functional modules in the future.
2. According to the basic division of land, the corresponding areas will be divided into public space, official space, and private space. Currently, Blue Soul will first be deployed in the official space.
3. The main function division of Blue Soul will be divided into official space editing content,  links, combined with land use to form a map.

title: Optimism | Governance Fund Cycle 3 Proposals
body:
## TL;DR:

* Voting cycle 3 (or round two Phase 1 of the Optimism Governance Fund) concludes on Jul 20, 2022. Nine proposers requested \~4.1m $OP tokens worth \~$3.1m USD at time of drafting this post
* As an Optimism delegate, I voted **FOR** four proposals and **AGAINST** five. For this round of proposals, Iâ€™ve beta tested a scorecard methodology to evaluating proposals (explained within this post)
* Although not relevant to the Governance Fund, I want to support the Optimism ecosystem due to what I perceive to be a sound â€œone commandmentâ€ commitment to Retroactive Public Goods Funding (RPGF)

Optimism governance voting takes place on [Snapshot](https://snapshot.org/#/opcollective.eth), governance overview information is organized on [Boardroom.io](https://boardroom.io/optimism/overview), and proposal submission and feedback takes place on [Discourse](https://gov.optimism.io/).

If I got anything wrong or for anyone who would like to collaborate to improve or influence my governance approach as an Optimism delegate, reply to this companion [TWEET](https://twitter.com/rasmuky/status/1549412642607038464?s=20&t=NjMvOFJ4ZkkPsxZsr3qhZg).


---

## Optimism token and governance fund overview

### Why Optimism for me

My current favored L1 nation is Ethereum and Iâ€™m in the process of making Optimism my L2 neighborhood. I am drawn to the Optimism commitment to maximize [Retroactive Public Goods Funding](https://medium.com/ethereum-optimism/retroactive-public-goods-funding-33c9b7d00f0c) (RPGF). If Optimism is able to maximize â€œgoodâ€ MEV capture and remain economically and technically competitive to other chains, I think that would be a great outcome for the network and ecosystem writ large and create public goods for the masses. Providing economic incentives to build public goods should support mass adoption and long-term use of the ecosystem.

I plan to spend more time with Arbirtrum, Polygon, and the zero knowledge L2â€™s coming online soon, but Optimism appears to be committed to a â€œ[one commandment](https://thenetworkstate.com/the-one-commandment)â€ (a la the [Network State](https://thenetworkstate.com/preamble)) focus on RPFG. I like RPGF as a single commandment.

I also plan to dive deeper into Cosmos and itâ€™s app chain / IPFS ecosystem at a future date as it sounds like there are a lot of interesting possibilities with that architecture as well.

### The Optimism token allocation

The Optimism token dropped end of April 2022 and is broken down as follows:

![https://community.optimism.io/docs/governance/allocations/#](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/w7CP_dEbs1bNmloFWnfvy.jpeg?height=1440&width=2880&&&size=medium)

For the purposes of this post, Iâ€™ll focus on the Governance Fund (GF, 5.4% slice) under the Ecosystem Fund (25% slice) above. Live proposals on Boardroom and Discourse all relate to phase one, which ends in two days (Jul 20, 2022).

## Governance fund phase 1 overview

### General guidance

There is a good overview of the GF and more specifically Phase 1 [HERE](https://community.optimism.io/docs/governance/gov-fund/). The highlights are:

* Any project launched on Optimism is eligible to submit a proposal
* Proposals must include a plan for how the tokens will incentivize growth on Optimism
* Although not a strict requirement, the Optimism Foundation recommends that each project submitting a Governance Fund proposal include a commitment to match OP token incentives with their own project incentives
* Proposals are reviewed and approved by the Token House (OP holders, or their delegates)
* When a project gets a proposal approved, they are still eligible to apply for further proposals
  * Recommendation is that projects distribute their initial allocation of tokens before requesting further tokens
  * Projects are also encouraged to reference data from the success of their initial distribution to strengthen their case in future proposals

### Amount of tokens requested by proposers

Below are two tables I created to frame the magnitude of the nine proposals in relation to the total governance fund:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tf1o1GXn8GjiNdH3VEKgC.png?height=2880&width=5760&size=medium)

Assuming Iâ€™ve interpreted the various governance docs correctly, phase 1 proposals currently up for vote (cycle 3) represent 1.7% of the total GF (for a total of \~$3.1m USD at time of drafting on Jul 18th, 2022). Assuming Phase 0 was fully allocated to the cap, there is still 65.2% of the GF to allocate in future phase 1 cycles.

### Overview of delegators and the token house

The token house is comprised of all $OP token delegates. Holders of $OP = delegates if the holder agrees to the responsibility of acting as a delegate and participating in governance. If a holder of $OP chooses to not participate in governance, that holder may delegate their tokens to a proxy delegate. I have self delegated and plan to participate in governance going forward.

Here is an overview of how the token house fits into the broad Optimism governance structure, for reference:

![https://community.optimism.io/docs/governance/](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/G1U4xGL_l3jcVPitYDizm.jpeg?height=822&width=1216)

## Rasmukyâ€™s proposal evaluation scorecard approach

### Scorecard overview

In an attempt to evaluate proposals in a consistent way and in line with guidance provided by the Optimism core team, I developed a basic scorecard:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fPSu_ty1wSBs-7HfP3P2m.png?height=284&width=444)

Iâ€™ll iterate on the approach for future processes, but conceptually:

* Factors developed based on guidance from Optimism Collective, reading through comments on Discourse from other delegates, and considering factors that matter to me personally or that I feel are positive for the network
* Weights were subjectively developed and will be reevaluated for future phases or future proposals
* I plan to rank each factor on a 0-10 scale, with a **hurdle of 5.0** for a **FOR** vote.
* For parameters which appear more binary (i.e., project on Optimism)
  * No will render as 0
  * Yes as 5 so as to not negatively impact hurdle score of 5.0
  * If itâ€™s obvious the project is heavily invested in Optimism, can scale up from 5 to as high as 10
* The respective weights will be applied to the 0-10 score and then aggregated to produce a weighted score

All of this is very subjective, but this approach is likely less subjective than just saying â€œI like the project, yes vote from me.â€

### Expected evolution of scorecard process

I only recently began to immerse in the Optimism governance process, so this scorecard and broad approach will be refined for future phases or proposal cohorts. Ideally, I would have spent more time engaging on Discourse with the proposers for this tranche, but alas.

With more time to research and engage more with proposers, I would likely include other factors like protocol decentralization, open source codebase, chain of custody of digital assets, approach / emphasis on security, evaluation of grant size request relative to other historical proposals, robust assessment / diligence of on chain metrics (across all chains), etc.

The diligence of on chain metrics is factor and value add to the Optimistic Collective Iâ€™m most excited about. I believe I could provide an objective analysis of proposer protocol use and growth which all Optimism delegates could use for their proposal evaluation process. Data and analytics diligence is what I currently do in Web2, so Iâ€™m very comfortable objectively analyzing data, engaging with management teams to stress test my interpretations, and then packaging outputs for intuitive interpretation by a wide range of user profiles.

If other delegates choose to deploy a scorecard style approach, ideally delegates would decide the parameters that are most important to them, develop their own weights, etc. A diverse set of approaches to governance is healthy, this is simply the approach I chose for this round.

## Overview of phase 1 proposal evaluations

As I was late to the party for this round of proposals, Iâ€™ll be brief. Also, at snapshot I only held 1.6k $OP tokens and had none delegated to me, so no vote I cast will move the needle on proposals in this round.

I expect to increase my future phase vote impact (i) as I accumulate my own $OP stake and (ii) by earning $OP token holders support as a prudent and thoughtful delegate. [DM me on Twitter](https://twitter.com/rasmuky) if you would like to discuss delegating to me.

### Proposal A | Superfluid

[Superfluid](https://www.superfluid.finance/home) is a protocol which enables payment streaming (e.g., high frequency settlement, like salary payments every day). I voted **FOR** for this proposal, scorecard output:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/IiGpH0RR2DRXSQIoARcp_.png?height=282&width=550)

Highlights:

* **Plan for how tokens will incentivize growth (+)** - Products like Superfluid tend to be very sticky once organizations / people begin to program payments or streams. Iâ€™m not sure of the adoption or competitor set, but relative to more mercenary capital / temporary use cases, I think there is more potential for long-term Optimism adoption and growth with Superfliud
* **Transparency of proposer to end recipient (+/-)** - A portion of $OP tokens will be utilized to subsidize fees to set up and execute streams, which should be pretty easy to observe and directly benefit Optimism. A separate portion will be allocated to developers to support migration of treasuries and other activities to Optimism. It would be very challenging to validate or verify that use of GF grant is to the benefit of the Optimism network in the case of developer compensation (the developer could have been working on a different chain)
* **Money on chain / alternative to TradFi (+)** - Iâ€™m a big believer that creating boring use cases to lure retail users away from TradFi banks and get them on chain will drive adoption. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve ever met someone who genuinely likes their retail bank, huge opportunity. Creating set it and forget it programmed payments and receipts platform which would improve money fluidity and access is in line with this concept

For reference, [Boardroom.io](https://boardroom.io/optimism/proposal/cHJvcG9zYWw6b3B0aW1pc206c25hcHNob3Q6MHg2MjVlNzBkY2ZmMzViZTA0Mjc3ODY4NGQ2NmNiM2UyNGVmZDM1YmRjNDIyMmQyNjMwNDdhZmQyNjk5MTg4ZmI2) and [Discourse](https://gov.optimism.io/t/ready-gf-phase-1-proposal-superfluid/2314).

### Proposal B | Kromatika

[Kromatika](https://kromatika.finance/) is a swap DEX with an optimized approach to limit orders. I voted **FOR** this proposal, scorecard output:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/o61ULQ_SoS1ZYLp30yKNO.png?height=283&width=551)

Highlights:

* **Growth on Optimism** - I do think that limit orders are a relatively basic building block of finance and markets. I havenâ€™t used the product (I will soon), but if the platform works well I can see it being a sticky protocol
* **Rewards / incentives transparency (+/-)** - Marketing and especially influencer marketing tends to carry a negative connotation in Web3, but I think it is important and leveraging high quality educational influencer material is a good choice. While the ecosystem is very small, organic growth based on word of mouth is achievable. As the ecosystem continues to grow, I think fluency in marketing will be very important. However, I donâ€™t have a clear view of how influencer marketing spend or early user drops will be traced into actions on Optimism
* **Money on chain alternative to TradFi** - As mentioned, limit orders is a relatively basic use case so I suspect many retail users would benefit from Kromatika. If I thought more average retail TradFi users were actively trading with limit orders this factor would have carried more weight

For reference, [Boardroom.io](https://boardroom.io/optimism/proposal/cHJvcG9zYWw6b3B0aW1pc206c25hcHNob3Q6MHgwMzdlNDE0OGNmOGZlYjcwNmMwMjMxMDhlMWM4MmY5ZDc2NWE2YzYyMTdkY2VmOWFlMzY3YTY3MjY4MzgyMGU5) and [Discourse](https://gov.optimism.io/t/ready-gf-phase-1-proposal-kromatika/2650/11).

### Proposal C | Hundred Finance

[Hundred Finance](https://hundred.finance/) is a lend borrow protocol for DeFi. I voted **FOR** this proposal, scorecard output:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yJqqJf8EbN26c4jTp6hA0.png?height=283&width=550)

Highlights:

* **Growth on Optimism (-)** - Incentives appear to be majority based on yield farming emissions which generally attracts mercenary capital
* **Proposer funded incentives (+)** - Proposer committed to substantial co-incentives to generate attractive yields for users. Ranges provided where quite wide, so some refinement or monitoring of co-incentives would be a good check
* **New to Optimism (+)** - Slight positive based on cross chain lend / borrow activity as that sounds like a unique product to me. Unclear how that may impact activity on chain (is cross chain positive for Optimism or not?), but sounds interesting to test

For reference, [Boardroom.io](https://boardroom.io/optimism/proposal/cHJvcG9zYWw6b3B0aW1pc206c25hcHNob3Q6MHhlM2Y0NzEzY2ExZGNmZThlOWUzZTNmNTk1NjBlMjg4OTVhODg5NWI1NTljYzFmMjMzMWNhNDAxY2U1MTEyNWY0) and [Discourse](https://gov.optimism.io/t/ready-gf-phase-1-hundred-finance/2733).

The proposal appears to center around [Hyphen](https://www.biconomy.io/hyphen-page) (bridge protocol) and [Gasless](https://www.biconomy.io/gasless-page) (partner protocol test subsidizer).  I voted **FOR** this proposal, scorecard output:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3dQoYtC9RqWDnQLulvIdS.png?height=283&width=550)

Highlights:

* **Growth on Optimism (+)** - Liquidity incentives to support bridging to Optimism and gasless incentives to incentivize testing of dApps on Optimism has potential to be a tailwind for growth. Also, the fact that the Biconomy is open to collaborating with the token house to select worthy dApps is a good gesture as well
* **Proposer match (+/-)** - Score is simply the match ratio as stipulated by the proposer
* **New product / demand need (+)** - The Gasless product is very versatile in that it can incent users to migrate to Optimism to utilize a wide variety of dApps, presumably many of which would be new to the Optimism network

For reference, [Boardroom.io](https://boardroom.io/optimism/proposal/cHJvcG9zYWw6b3B0aW1pc206c25hcHNob3Q6MHgyYTgzZDA0OTA1NDI4NWNjN2JiOWM4OTU5OWQ0NjkwNDViNzZkMjlkN2FjZTk5MjhhYjJiMDViZDAxYTcyYWVk) and [Discourse](https://gov.optimism.io/t/ready-gf-phase-1-proposal-biconomy/2880).

[Dope Wars](https://dopewars.gg/) is an MMO (massively multiplayer online) game in line with Grand Theft Auto. This is not an area of the ecosystem which Iâ€™m fluent in, though Dope Wars presents as committed to making Optimism itâ€™s home base. I voted **AGAINST**, scorecard output:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-mC5bzOopZ-n_L0hTPtjD.png?height=283&width=550)

* **New product / additional demand (+)** - Blockchain gaming is not prevalent on Optimism to my knowledge, but can definitely drive a lot of volume if the respective game achieves solid traction

[Saddle Finance](https://saddle.finance/#/) is a token swap platform focused on stable coin liquidity and which caters to traders and LP pools. I voted **AGAINST** this proposal, scorecard output:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2Hvf-T2CxcFeL_mUJw1Zm.png?height=283&width=551)

Highlights:

* **Incentivization of growth of Optimism (-)** - The incentives are largely liquidity mining incentives, which typically are more mercenary in nature. It sounds unlikely these incentives would result in meaningful long-term growth for the Optimism ecosystem
* **Rewards transparency (+)** - Although the stickiness of the rewards are uncertain, transparency as to use of funds should be clear if visible on chain via yield farming

There are definitely some protocols / projects which appear to be value accretive to Optimism in this Governance Fund cohort. I look forward to engaging with the next cohort of proposals in cycle 4 and refining my evaluation approach.

## TL;DR:

* Voting cycle 3 (or round two Phase 1 of the Optimism Governance Fund) concludes on Jul 20, 2022. Nine proposers requested \~4.1m $OP tokens worth \~$3.1m USD at time of drafting this post

* Although not relevant to the Governance Fund, I want to support the Optimism ecosystem due to what I perceive to be a sound â€œone commandmentâ€ commitment to Retroactive Public Goods Funding (RPGF)

Optimism governance voting takes place on [Snapshot](https://snapshot.org/#/opcollective.eth), governance overview information is organized on [Boardroom.io](https://boardroom.io/optimism/overview), and proposal submission and feedback takes place on [Discourse](https://gov.optimism.io/).

If I got anything wrong or for anyone who would like to collaborate to improve or influence my governance approach as an Optimism delegate, reply to this companion [TWEET](https://twitter.com/rasmuky/status/1549412642607038464?s=20&t=NjMvOFJ4ZkkPsxZsr3qhZg).


---

## Optimism token and governance fund overview

### Why Optimism for me

My current favored L1 nation is Ethereum and Iâ€™m in the process of making Optimism my L2 neighborhood. I am drawn to the Optimism commitment to maximize [Retroactive Public Goods Funding](https://medium.com/ethereum-optimism/retroactive-public-goods-funding-33c9b7d00f0c) (RPGF). If Optimism is able to maximize â€œgoodâ€ MEV capture and remain economically and technically competitive to other chains, I think that would be a great outcome for the network and ecosystem writ large and create public goods for the masses. Providing economic incentives to build public goods should support mass adoption and long-term use of the ecosystem.

I plan to spend more time with Arbirtrum, Polygon, and the zero knowledge L2â€™s coming online soon, but Optimism appears to be committed to a â€œ[one commandment](https://thenetworkstate.com/the-one-commandment)â€ (a la the [Network State](https://thenetworkstate.com/preamble)) focus on RPFG. I like RPGF as a single commandment.

I also plan to dive deeper into Cosmos and itâ€™s app chain / IPFS ecosystem at a future date as it sounds like there are a lot of interesting possibilities with that architecture as well.

### The Optimism token allocation

The Optimism token dropped end of April 2022 and is broken down as follows:

![https://community.optimism.io/docs/governance/allocations/#](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/w7CP_dEbs1bNmloFWnfvy.jpeg?height=1440&width=2880&&&size=medium)

For the purposes of this post, Iâ€™ll focus on the Governance Fund (GF, 5.4% slice) under the Ecosystem Fund (25% slice) above. Live proposals on Boardroom and Discourse all relate to phase one, which ends in two days (Jul 20, 2022).

## Governance fund phase 1 overview

### General guidance

There is a good overview of the GF and more specifically Phase 1 [HERE](https://community.optimism.io/docs/governance/gov-fund/). The highlights are:

* Any project launched on Optimism is eligible to submit a proposal
* Proposals must include a plan for how the tokens will incentivize growth on Optimism
* Although not a strict requirement, the Optimism Foundation recommends that each project submitting a Governance Fund proposal include a commitment to match OP token incentives with their own project incentives
* Proposals are reviewed and approved by the Token House (OP holders, or their delegates)
* When a project gets a proposal approved, they are still eligible to apply for further proposals
  * Recommendation is that projects distribute their initial allocation of tokens before requesting further tokens
  * Projects are also encouraged to reference data from the success of their initial distribution to strengthen their case in future proposals

### Amount of tokens requested by proposers

Below are two tables I created to frame the magnitude of the nine proposals in relation to the total governance fund:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tf1o1GXn8GjiNdH3VEKgC.png?height=2880&width=5760&size=medium)

Assuming Iâ€™ve interpreted the various governance docs correctly, phase 1 proposals up for vote represent 1.7% of the total GF (for a total of \~$3.1m USD at time of drafting on Jul 18th, 2022). Assuming Phase 0 was fully allocated to the cap, there is still 65.2% of the GF to allocate in future phase 1 cycles.

### Overview of delegators and the token house

The token house is comprised of all $OP token delegates. Holders of $OP = delegates if the holder agrees to the responsibility of acting as a delegate and participating in governance. If a holder of $OP chooses to not participate in governance, that holder may delegate their tokens to a proxy delegate. I have self delegated and plan to participate in governance going forward.

Here is an overview of how the token house fits into the broad Optimism governance structure, for reference:

![https://community.optimism.io/docs/governance/](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/G1U4xGL_l3jcVPitYDizm.jpeg?height=822&width=1216)

## Rasmukyâ€™s proposal evaluation scorecard approach

### Scorecard overview

In an attempt to evaluate proposals in a consistent way and in line with guidance provided by the Optimism core team, I developed a basic scorecard:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fPSu_ty1wSBs-7HfP3P2m.png?height=284&width=444)

Iâ€™ll iterate on the approach for future processes, but conceptually:

* Factors developed based on guidance from Optimism Collective, reading through comments on Discourse from other delegates, and considering factors that matter to me personally or that I feel are positive for the network
* Weights were subjectively developed and will be reevaluated for future phases or future proposals
* I plan to rank each factor on a 0-10 scale, with a **hurdle of 5.0** for a **FOR** vote.
* For parameters which appear more binary (i.e., project on Optimism)
  * No will render as 0
  * Yes as 5 so as to not negatively impact hurdle score of 5.0
  * If itâ€™s obvious the project is heavily invested in Optimism, can scale up from 5 to as high as 10
* The respective weights will be applied to the 0-10 score and then aggregated to produce a weighted score

All of this is very subjective, but this approach is likely less subjective than just saying â€œI like the project, yes vote from me.â€

### Expected evolution of scorecard process

I only recently began to immerse in the Optimism governance process, so this scorecard and broad approach will be refined for future phases or proposal cohorts. Ideally, I would have spent more time engaging on Discourse with the proposers for this tranche, but alas.

With more time to research and engage more with proposers, I would likely include other factors like protocol decentralization, open source codebase, chain of custody of digital assets, approach / emphasis on security, evaluation of grant size request relative to other historical proposals, robust assessment / diligence of on chain metrics (across all chains), etc.

The diligence of on chain metrics is factor and value add to the Optimistic Collective Iâ€™m most excited about. I believe I could provide an objective analysis of proposer protocol use and growth which all Optimism delegates could use for their proposal evaluation process. Data and analytics diligence is what I currently do in Web2, so Iâ€™m very comfortable objectively analyzing data, engaging with management teams to stress test my interpretations, and then packaging outputs for intuitive interpretation by a wide range of user profiles.

If other delegates choose to deploy a scorecard style approach, ideally delegates would decide the parameters that are most important to them, develop their own weights, etc. A diverse set of approaches to governance is healthy, this is simply the approach I chose for this round.

The proposal appears to center around [Hyphen](https://www.biconomy.io/hyphen-page) (bridge protocol) and [Gasless](https://www.biconomy.io/gasless-page) (partner protocol test subsidizer).  I voted **FOR** this proposal, scorecard output:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3dQoYtC9RqWDnQLulvIdS.png?height=283&width=550)

Highlights:

* **Growth on Optimism (+)** - Liquidity incentives to support bridging to Optimism and gasless incentives to incentivize testing of dApps on Optimism has potential to be a tailwind for growth. Also, the fact that the Biconomy is open to collaborating with the token house to select worthy dApps is a good gesture as well
* **Proposer match (+/-)** - Score is simply the match ratio as stipulated by the proposer
* **New product / demand need (+)** - The Gasless product is very versatile in that it can incent users to migrate to Optimism to utilize a wide variety of dApps, presumably many of which would be new to the Optimism network

For reference, [Boardroom.io](https://boardroom.io/optimism/proposal/cHJvcG9zYWw6b3B0aW1pc206c25hcHNob3Q6MHgyYTgzZDA0OTA1NDI4NWNjN2JiOWM4OTU5OWQ0NjkwNDViNzZkMjlkN2FjZTk5MjhhYjJiMDViZDAxYTcyYWVk) and [Discourse](https://gov.optimism.io/t/ready-gf-phase-1-proposal-biconomy/2880).

### Proposal E | Dope Wars

[Dope Wars](https://dopewars.gg/) is an MMO (massively multiplayer online) game in line with Grand Theft Auto. This is not an area of the ecosystem which Iâ€™m fluent in, though Dope Wars presents as committed to making Optimism itâ€™s home base. I voted **AGAINST**, scorecard output:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-mC5bzOopZ-n_L0hTPtjD.png?height=283&width=550)

Highlights:

* **New product / additional demand (+)** - Blockchain gaming is not prevalent on Optimism to my knowledge, but can definitely drive a lot of volume if the respective game achieves solid traction
* **incentives / rewards transparency (-)** - A portion of the incentives are slated to go into the project treasury, which is likely to be very opaque and hard to correlate to growth on Optimism

For reference, [Boardroom.io](https://boardroom.io/optimism/proposal/cHJvcG9zYWw6b3B0aW1pc206c25hcHNob3Q6MHhhNDk3YWYxMWFiMzFlNjM4ZDM4YmNmNmQ1NzY4OWE1NzI5YmY2NmVlMWMzZmQ4OWYyMGJjZDdkOWU2ZmE2ZDRi) and [Discourse](https://gov.optimism.io/t/ready-gf-phase-1-proposal-dope-wars/2722).

### Proposal F | Infinity Wallet

[Infinity Wallet](https://infinitywallet.io/) is a multi-chain desktop focused crypto wallet with robust native integrations with various dApps. I voted **AGAINST** this proposal, scorecard output:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/S0NPKuOZW6k-_vGXgBf9R.png?height=282&width=550)

Highlights:

* **Growth on Optimism (+)** - A dApp native integration approach could be very sticky if the UI / UX is positive. I have not used the product, but do see value in the concept
* **New product (-)** - There are multiple wallets operational on Optimism. The native dApp integration sounds interesting, but Iâ€™m underwhelmed about the braggadocio of being desktop focused. Humans are mobile
* **Incentives / rewards transparency (-)** - 80% of the incentives / rewards are earmarked for developers, which is generally great. Validating what developers are working on is no easy task, so I suspect confidence of prudent spend would be challenging to verify or get comfortable with

For reference, [Boardroom.io](https://boardroom.io/optimism/proposal/cHJvcG9zYWw6b3B0aW1pc206c25hcHNob3Q6MHgxY2I1NWI3ZGFjYTM4YTM3ZGZkMjUwNzIxODMyOWZiNWQ3OTEyYWM1YjIzNzg1OWM1NDdkY2VhMDExNTIzMWQ3) and [Discourse](https://gov.optimism.io/t/ready-gf-phase-1-cycle-3-proposal-infinity-wallet/2713/95).

### Proposal G | Dexguru

[DexGuru](https://dex.guru/token/0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2-eth) is a crypto trading platform. I voted **AGAINST** this proposal, scorecard output:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_px_1f_6ElI4V_YfP040y.png?height=283&width=551)

Highlights:

* **Growth on Optimism and incentives transparency (-)** - Incentives primarily go to developer resources in the DexGuru DAO. Understanding how those incentives translate into time and attention on developing the Optimism ecosystem would be a challenge in my opinion

For reference, [Boardroom.io](https://boardroom.io/optimism/proposal/cHJvcG9zYWw6b3B0aW1pc206c25hcHNob3Q6MHgzYzU2MDM1MjJkNmE5NTdiMjQ0NWY2OTBmNjk1MjI5MGQ1Y2MwZWZiMGEyOGViM2UxZjQ0YWY1OTliYTk2OTNm) and [Discourse](https://gov.optimism.io/t/ready-gf-phase-1-proposal-dexguru/2536).

### Proposal H | Overnight.fi

[Overnight.Fi](https://overnight.fi/) is the creator of USD+, a high yield rebasing token backed with USDC. I voted **AGAINST** this proposal, scorecard output:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/71o4zcSOxXBhYnJDglgs6.png?height=282&width=550)

Highlights:

* **Growth on Optimism (-)** - Proposal plan is to provide incentives to increase LP liquidity / yield farming, which tends to attract mercenary capital. I think the long-term growth on Optimism from these types of strategies is uncertain at best
* **Proposer incentives - USD+ (-)** -  Produces yield as a result of yield farming strategies, but the proposer team has not matched incentives to further drive growth on Optimism

For reference, [Boardroom.io](https://boardroom.io/optimism/proposal/cHJvcG9zYWw6b3B0aW1pc206c25hcHNob3Q6MHhiMzIxYTBjYjE5MTQ3YTc1Y2NjYTQxZDQ4MjU5NGQ3ODU2NzNiNzY3NTkzYTBkMjU5NjRjN2VjOWEzMzU4MTI4) and [Discourse](https://gov.optimism.io/t/ready-gf-phase-1-overnight-fi/2816).

### Proposal I | Saddle Finance

[Saddle Finance](https://saddle.finance/#/) is a token swap platform focused on stable coin liquidity and which caters to traders and LP pools. I voted **AGAINST** this proposal, scorecard output:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2Hvf-T2CxcFeL_mUJw1Zm.png?height=283&width=551)

Highlights:

* **Incentivization of growth of Optimism (-)** - The incentives are largely liquidity mining incentives, which typically are more mercenary in nature. It sounds unlikely these incentives would result in meaningful long-term growth for the Optimism ecosystem
* **Rewards transparency (+)** - Although the stickiness of the rewards are uncertain, transparency as to use of funds should be clear if visible on chain via yield farming
* **Forum engagement (-)** - Itâ€™s hard to conclude in many cases with no background knowledge, but my general thought is that when an organization is asking for a grant they should go out of their way to to be as cordial, productive, and positive as possible in the discourse. Everyone absolutely deserves the right to defend themselves and their organization, but reiterating data driven positive elements of their proposal and staying on topic is what I look for from a proposal team

For reference, [Boardroom.io](https://boardroom.io/optimism/proposal/cHJvcG9zYWw6b3B0aW1pc206c25hcHNob3Q6MHgzNmNkZjI4MGZlOGMzNzYwNTYxZTc2ZDU3YTllNzAyMmNiMzgzZTc4OWNlODBiNzBlZDc5MWM2YTY4MTY2YWZi) and [Discourse](https://gov.optimism.io/t/ready-gf-phase-1-proposal-saddle-finance/2842).

## Outro

There are definitely some protocols / projects which appear to be value accretive to Optimism in this Governance Fund cohort. I look forward to engaging with the next cohort of proposals and refining my evaluation approach.

Let me know what you think I got wrong in this companion [TWEET](https://twitter.com/rasmuky/status/1549412642607038464?s=20&t=NjMvOFJ4ZkkPsxZsr3qhZg)! I want this approach well oiled to do my part to contribute to the Optimism ecosystem.

# The Great Airdrop Debate

## A New Airdrop Adventure

As I am embarking on another journey into unfamiliar territory, I am reflecting back on the best and the worst airdrops I have been a part of. The Arbitrum Odyssey just kicked off and it appears to be a super exciting event, spanning across eight weeks and multiple NFT airdrops. Will this be a successful series of airdrops? Will it meet the expectations of both the builders and users across this growing ecosystem? Honestly, I can not wait to find out; especially, because I have not explored Ethereum and its Layer 2 protocols and dApps. If you are interested in joining this Odyssey, I have left links in the Sources section below the article to get you started.

## The Best Airdrop

Not surprisingly, being an avid experimenter, I have participated in and received nearly a hundred airdrops. In the process, I have developed a short list of what qualifies as a successful token airdrop (fungible or non-fungible).

Here it is:

* the protocol or dApp has defined, communicated, and stood by the airdrop distribution criteria
* the distribution supports the future value of the protocol
* the airdrop is designed to avoid a â€œsell and dumpâ€ of the token event
* upon releasing the airdrop, there exists functionality in the protocol or dApp
* the airdrop recipient should be required to engage with the blockchain, protocol, or dApp.

Why am I proponent of having to work for your drop? Why not just distribute it wide and far? Because, those events make up my short list of the worst airdrops I have participated in.

## The Worst Airdrop

Here is that list of what I think makes for a forgettable airdrop event:

* the airdrop criteria are poorly communicated
* the airdrop criteria are changed, after the announcement communication has been released
* the airdrop comes with a bribe that negatively affects another team of builders or group of users
* the airdropped tokens are released all at once
* the protocol or dApp airdrop functionality does not work or crashes
* congestion and transaction delays lead to frustration
* drops using whitelists (borrowing from todayâ€™s Wordle, that is simply an â€œawfulâ€ name, which exemplifies misplaced exclusivity)
* there is no utility in the protocol or dApp when the airdrop is released.
* the airdrop comes with a staking requirement; yet, there is no introduction of use cases from the protocol or dApp for many months thereafter.

All these types of events inevitably result in an extremely short-term rapid rise in the price of the airdropped token and a subsequent prolonged drop. User engagement disappears as quickly as the value of the token.

Instead, letâ€™s look at some examples of the types of airdrops that I thought were really cool, super interesting, and resulted in positive experiences for both the users and the builders.

## Phased Airdrops

The airdrops that are divided into distinct phases are very effective. They make the user come back again and again to interact with the dApp. This method also ensures that the token is not bombarded with massive amounts of sell pressure, all at once.

The most successful of these events I have personally experienced were those that tied receiving a portion of the airdrop to specific launches of dApps on the protocol, new functionality implemented in stages, or milestones reached. For example, I have seen numerous DeFi protocols use the following approach:

* Phase One â€” launch the token and enable staking
* Phase Two â€” open the swap functionality
* Phase Three â€” open the liquidity pools
* Phase Four â€” commence incentivized farming.

Of course, if extended periods of time pass between these phases, the effects are diluted and user engagement is weakened.

## A Task Oriented Approach

I really like this type of an airdrop, because working for the free tokens is the way to ensure user engagement with the products.

Specific examples of the task oriented approach include:

* transfer the tokens across a bridge
* stake some of the tokens
* participate in a governance vote
* swap some of the airdropped tokens to another token that interacts with the blockchain, protocol, or dApp.
* supply collateral to a lending dApp.
* mint a stabletoken.

As a user, I want to perform multiple tasks, because that way I really learn how the protocol works and what is possible with the technology. Usually, it also leads me to try other products, inject additional funds, or increase my engagement.

## Implement Utility First

One of my pet peeves is receiving tokens in an airdrop and excitedly going to the dApp to see what is offered and findingâ€¦.nothing!

You all know who you are: ghost chains, protocols under construction, and invisible dApps floating around in the crypto universe that have tokens and nothing else. What is the point of releasing a token if you are not going to have utility ready and deployed first?

New builders, can you please make sure you have utility implemented when you release your airdrop? If that seems daunting, I have seen plenty of chains launch testnets, airdrop tokens on the testnet, get lots of user interaction, work out all the bugs, and subsequently launch successfully on the mainnet to a wider audience.

## NFT Drops

Nothing puzzles me more than new NFT projects that generate lots of community engagement with amazing marketing campaigns, launch a successful genesis NFT collection with beautiful designs, just to go silent for months and not do a thing.

Why not take advantage of all that excitement and have multiple, additional functionalities and products ready to deploy in the weeks and months following the genesis drop? I have seen plenty of great airdrop ideas for this concept, including:

* airdrops of auxiliary collections to the genesis NFT owners
* airdrop loot NFTâ€™s to the genesis NFT owners
* have the NFT unlock opportunities in a game
* launch a secondary collection and use the same airdrop strategy
* use NFT airdrops to users that perform tasks in the dApps.

And since I am such a staunch opponent of those exclusive â€œreservation listsâ€, here is another idea that I have seen work with great success. Launch a token, which the prospective owners of the NFT can purchase, stake, and farm it in order to receive a ticket to the minting event. Who needs a â€œexclusionary listâ€ when you have a ticket machine?

And then there is the whole concept of reward NFTâ€™s being developed, literally as we speak. These NFTâ€™s could also be airdropped, but the tokens are received over time as rewards, which are tied directly to the NFT.

## Novel Approaches

The protocols that come up with the most unique approaches to getting their tokens in circulation via airdrops are the ones that I believe have experienced the most success.

Besides the ones mentioned above, I have encountered additional (more complicated) examples, including:

* requiring tokens to be bonded and farmed
* vesting of tokens with a steady stream of rewards
* locking up tokens with a promise of future rewards
* paying out increasing amounts of rewards depending on the length of the lock-up periods
* providing liquid derivative tokens in return for staking tokens.

All of these methods ensure the longevity of the protocol and the stability of the token.

## Executing for Success

As I embark on a new adventure, one that once again involves airdrops, I wanted to share some of my thoughts on the subject with you. Obviously this is not an exhaustive list and I would love to hear from you what other effective airdrops you have participated in.

There are as many different points of view on how to successfully execute an airdrop, as there are protocols in the crypto universe. Therefore, I suspect that the Great Airdrop Debate will rage on. But, next time when you participate in that airdrop for a token that has no utility, you know what to do. And those that do have utility, that encourage you to learn something unexpected, experience something unique, and allow you to engage with people across the globe, they are the keepers.

Hopefully, I have been able to share some valuable points of view in this debate; in the meantime, I look forward to exploring Arbitrumâ€™s Odyssey and having some cool NFTâ€™s airdropped to me as a reward for my enthusiastic participation.

Het avontuur gaat door â€” Opa.

title: Music NFTs: I'm not convinced...yet.
body:
### NFTs in Music - Why I'm not convinced (yet)

**Spotify:** Today, do music streaming apps know I've bought an NFT song / album so it plays onlyÂ ***via my***Â Spotify or Apple music account? How do I show off my NFT playlist or that one off exclusive NFT song remix (well, ok... NFT 0008 off of a 1000 mint) that I paid a bomb for.

Rarity proof when it matters...how?

**NFT Music Concert Tickets:** How practical is it to authenticate NFT tickets displayed as a screenshot / dApp at a crowded concert gate? This is as much an open question as it is food-for-thought.

via twitter, a user @Mousselect pointed me toÂ **[this solution](https://faq.get-protocol.io/get-protocol-products/get-protocol-nft-ticket-explorer)**Â that may be worth investigating.

**Label Copyright Infringement:** Selling 'beats' and 'loops' as NFTs are cool, but what happens when the artist who minted them, then sells the album or song to a record label? What happens to the rights of the NFT loop buyer to use it in a remix/tune...

**Summary:** Corporates, Artists and Media organizations looking at the Metaverse, should see to it that these issues are ironed out before having them buy-in. Don't let men-in-Armani-suits sell a pitch deck that isn't finalized, yet filled with jargon du jour; (immutable ledger, block-chain, on-chain, DAO...etc.)

We aren't even talking about the \[very real\] blockchain inter-compatibility issues that arise. How would a music NFT bought on the Ethereum Blockchain play out when a user enters a "metaverse" running on the Algorand chain or the Solana chain and vice-versa. Would it be a seamless streaming experience for the user (avatar) as seamless as it is today when we *bluetooth* our music from headphones to car audio system?

Music NFTs before they are sold by studios and artistes should be addressing these questions. This would be the right way to methodically build Metaverses devoid of crypto-parasites, and speculators currently plaguing Web3.

...but wait... there could be a solution to some of these issues. I could think of at least the first issue:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Sgni8CvFkjji-GpvG-nko.webp?height=394&width=701)

### Community Wallets: For Enhanced NFT experiences

Tally Ho! is a new "**[community owned and operated Web3 wallet](https://tally.cash/)**" and since NFTs are all about building a sense of community while also allowing members of such communities to express their uniqueness, what if such a wallet had a feature and as food-for-thought, could for instance...

**Unlock a higher fidelity version as an NFT song? -**Â This would encourage artistes to release NFTs of their songs offering perhaps a superior sampled version of the tune. We all know that music streaming services probably aren't streaming at optimal quality,Â **[as this 2019 article explains.](https://www.headphonesty.com/2019/07/sample-rate-bit-depth-bit-rate/)**

What if...a wallet such as Tally Ho! were to intercept a Spotify users playlist using,Â **[the Spotify API,](https://www.headphonesty.com/2019/07/sample-rate-bit-depth-bit-rate/)**Â and if it detects a song on the user's playlist for which the user also has an NFT version -- the wallet could seamlessly stream the owned (higher quality) or even a unique re-mix that the artiste released only as an NFT? If I were a music artiste releasing an NFT this would be my strict mandate.Â 

Let's go further: The NFT could be recorded in a multichannel audio format - such as .mkv, where a single Music NFT could contain:

* Instrumental version.
* Acapella.
* Minus 1 (karaoke)

This way, at a party, the NFT owner's playlist could go from Karaoke, to amateur DJ. All because they invested in a music NFT. (You have to give the NFT owner value in owning that music NFT which is otherwise available for free to all on Spotify or Apple music...)

Of course, this would require a streaming player being part of the "wallet". But that's where community driven projects such as the Tally Ho! wallet can shine. Letting developers write enhancement 'plugins'.Â 

*This blog essay was written in response to a Blogging competition for the launch of the Tally Ho! wallet. I couldn't write just another article rehashing the virtues of a crypto- wallet (said to a Meta-Mask beating wallet).Â As a personal creative challenge to drive original thought, I brainstormed the above product ideas, aware they're worth a couple 100k to a product dept. at music streaming platforms looking at Web3.0-fying their platforms.*

Spotify, or Tidal or Apple...others... if you are planning on integrating NFT audio using any of these ideas, please send fiat currency, my way.
