title: Control emotion
body:
You're driving to work when a car cuts into your driveway and nearly hits your car. You go crazy right away, and it starts you off with a bad omen.
â€‹â€‹

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jVRpeQYIirSNbMjW0RFuq.png?height=270&width=384)


A colleague of yours called and said he was sick again, which means you'll be doing double work for the third time this month. Your own life has piled up, and you have to finish hers. You head to the manager's room, ready to explode.
â€‹â€‹
You bought a ticket to watch it with your family, but the dark clouds above your head are getting thicker and thicker, which disrupts your plans. Your child is disappointed, and you curse God for ruining your day.
â€‹â€‹
It would be great if you could control your emotions and get rid of these or other similar things that might happen, wouldn't it? It's natural to feel annoyed when things don't go as planned. But often, we overreact and create a domino effect that keeps us from seeing the bright side of things.
â€‹â€‹

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1zgY1108W-J7pWvC9b0vR.png?height=270&width=390)


Former world heavyweight boxing champion George Foreman had a good point: "Being angry and unhappy with someone is like letting it live in your head for free."
â€‹â€‹
Controlling emotions is a challenge for people of all ages. But it's totally doable! You are the only one directly responsible for your emotions. You are responsible for your actions and responses, and no one can make you respond a certain way.
â€‹â€‹
"The greatest discovery of my generation is that people can change the outer aspects of their lives by changing the inner attitude of their minds." The American philosopher William James once said at the end of the 19th century. Obviously, this problem has existed for a long time.
â€‹â€‹
Fortunately, there are some very effective ways to manage your emotions. Of course, this takes practice. But the payoff is unmistakable, and you will thank yourself for it. Here are a few areas to practice:
â€‹â€‹

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dlP3XfHgpl8iDlptW7037.png?height=270&width=373)

1. Develop good self-care habits. Take care of your physical, emotional and spiritual needs. People who do this regularly will be better able to deal with negativity. And will not pose a threat to others.
   â€‹â€‹
2. Identify feelings of anger and frustration - mentally and physically. The chances of acting recklessly are much greater if one is disconnected from one's own feelings.
   â€‹â€‹
3. Get out of the tension and go for a walk. Take the necessary time to process feelings and emotions. Time may be enough for a deep breath, or a slow count of 10.
   â€‹â€‹
4. Confess your emotions to those who are willing to listen but not judge.
   â€‹â€‹
5. Find a temporary distraction to do. This refers to doing something that gets your mind off the topic.
   â€‹â€‹
6. Take action. Think about how you can positively change the situation, and then take action to solve the problem.
   â€‹â€‹
7. Talk to those who can help you achieve change about your desire to make a change.
   â€‹â€‹
8. The mind should be "right", not "wrong".
   â€‹â€‹
   Here is a story worth thinking about: a shop run by a gardener, handed down by their family for generations. It is remembered that this generation of shop owners and previous generations were very positive people. Most people think it's because they run a successful store. In fact, the opposite is true.
   â€‹â€‹
   The shop has a tradition that the owner always wears a large badge on the lapel with the words "Business is good" on it. Although they are going through tough times just like everyone else, the attitude and badge of the shopkeeper never change.
   â€‹â€‹
   When everyone sees this badge for the first time, they all ask, "How good is the business?"
   â€‹â€‹
   After the badge sparked a conversation, the flower shop owner would tell a lot about the positive aspects of his business and work. Even people who feel miserable will feel much happier after listening to a few minutes of this infectious and optimistic shopkeeper.
   â€‹â€‹
   It's hard to give a measure of this attitude, but in a way, it may be a self-fulfilling prophecy. The owner once said frankly: "With this badge, good business will follow." In fact, when it comes to our lives and our lives, why not?

title: Weeks after Daily
body:
Weeks after Daily Harvest announced the [voluntary recall](http://www.cnn.com/2022/06/27/tech/daily-harvest-recall-influencers/index.html) of its French Lentil and Leek Crumbles, the company said on Tuesday that it had identified the ingredient suspected to be causing the [mysterious illness](https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/01/tech/daily-harvest-recall-lawsuits/index.html) reported by hundreds of customers.

"At this time, we have identified tara flour as the cause of the issue," Daily Harvest founder and CEO Rachel Drori said in a [company blog post](https://www.daily-harvest.com/content/french-lentil-leek-crumbles-advisory#) Tuesday afternoon. Tara flour is made from the seeds of tara trees, which are native to South America.

"This was the first and only time we've used tara flour, which has been available and used in the North American market as a plant-based source of protein prior to our use," Drori added. "Our investigation team will continue working with the \[US Food and Drug Administration\], the tara flour producer and others to help determine what specifically made people sick."

* 

The FDA said in a statement last week that its "investigation is ongoing" into the reports of illness linked to the product.

title: tea drinker
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dWdPGtWc2PPGEahOa7t0D.png?height=266&width=474)

I have been idle at home recently, sometimes a small dish of peanuts, a few good songs, and a few magazines can have a comfortable afternoon. Sometimes I occasionally step into a teahouse not far from my home to feel the different leisure and elegance.
â€‹â€‹
The tea is fragrant and the guzheng is lingering. There are many people who come here to taste tea, including some urban young people. They wear masks in their daily life and experience too much flattery, intrigue, and only It can make their hearts calm like the tea in this cup.
â€‹â€‹
The two elders sat opposite each other, and in front of them was an unfinished chess game. I think, here, for them, they may not only taste the tea in their hands, but also play the chess in front of them.
â€‹â€‹
In addition to drinking tea, I often hear: "Life is a dream, and tears are a thousand lines." then. Someone else said: "I've been wandering all my life, and it's almost sunset. I feel homesick and heartbroken. I dare to ask where is the road?" Yes, where is the road? What do teahouses and tea mean to tea drinkers?
â€‹â€‹
Perhaps, for urban youth, the teahouse is their post station;
â€‹â€‹
Perhaps, for the weather-beaten old people, tea is the precipitation of their years!
â€‹â€‹
Sometimes people who mix tea come to mix tea, look at the cup of tea that is getting full, and finally can't hold it, it overflows, I understand it, I finally understand, it turns out that the cup is only so big, and it can only hold so much. , it will only overflow for a long time, and the cup of tea in your hand will gradually fade and become dull. Life, why not? Don't hesitate when it's time to let go, but people think that the overflow is superfluous, but it's not, that's called giving up.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WKYveFbiyMDKZzYjfVIWW.png?height=270&width=378)


â€‹â€‹
Those who know how to give up are those who truly know how to cherish!
â€‹â€‹
In fact, from the first time a tea drinker tastes tea, it is not only the tea in their hands, but also the long-lasting tea in life. And people who taste tea can only taste two words for a lifetime: cherish.

title: ERC-4519: Non-Fungible Tokens Tied to Physical Assets (SmartNFT)
body:
Have you ever thought to have an NFT for your house? Maybe NFTs for your cars so you can sell your car using only NFTs, and not going to government for selling your cars. 

Every day smart assets are being introduced to world using Internet of Things (IoT) devices. Houses are now smart, cars are smart, phones are smart, watches are smart, etc. These smart houses can do many things, like providing homeowners security, comfort, convenience and energy efficiency by allowing them to control smart devices, often by a smart home app on their smartphone or other networked device. Smart cars can do many things like â€œCommunicatingâ€ Systems for Cars, System of 3D Gestures, Car Integration with Smartwatch, System for Automated Parking, Integration with different Apps, Full Integration with Phones. 

Most important point of them all is â€œowningâ€. Owning an asset like a phone or a house has many different aspects. In our â€œcentralisedâ€ world owning an asset is having the rights by the government. Government gives you the rights to sell, rent, or even destroy your asset. But in the decentralised world, government is not there to give you rights. Rights of sell, rent, and destroy or other things in the decentralised world is given to you by owning that asset. Owning in this world means differently from the centralised world. Owning an asset is having the asset in your wallet address. 

In the world of decentralisation, a virtual asset is an NFT that you own in your wallet. But what if you want to own your house or car as an NFT? ERC 721 or ERC 1155 that are described in [this article](https://mirror.xyz/0x2d209040c031d4e2D4d9cb4D3aabf18F52260AB0/YLdBJP9rIqzVc2vYH4LTC5rUwSdAst96F5IN8QhpWIw) cannot fulfil this action. They can not tie to real assets in the world. So another Ethereum standard is needed to tie NFTs to real assets. 

This standard is the [ERC 4519](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4519) standard, or as the call it â€œSmartNFTâ€. A SmartNFT is tied to a physical asset that can check if the tie is authentic or not. The SmartNFT can include an Ethereum address of the physical asset and, consequently, the physical asset can sign messages or transactions. The physical asset can operate with an operating mode that is defined by its SmartNFT with an attribute named state. The token state can define if the token owner or the token user can use the asset or not. A cryptographically secure mutual authentication process can be carried out between the physical asset and its owner or its user. SmartNFTs extend [ERC 721](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-721) non-fungible tokens, which only allow representing assets by a unique identifier, but not by an Ethereum address. Moreover, SmartNFTs extend ERC 721 NFTs to include users in addition to owners.

This SmartNFT was developed because the ERC 721 NFT does not include the users of an asset (only include the owners) and does not include the Ethereum address of the asset. Smart assets (for example, IoT devices) are increasing nowadays. If smart assets are tied to SmartNFTs then they can be managed in a secure and traceable way. The reason is that SmartNFTs, unlike ERC 721 NFTs, allow establishing secure communication channels between the physical asset and its owner and its user. In this way, assets, owners and users can be assured of exchanging information with trusted parties.

title: Starbucks said last
body:
Starbucks may [not be done closing stores](https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/12/business-food/starbucks-store-closures/index.html) over safety concerns.

"We are beginning to close stores," because of safety issues, [interim CEO Howard Schultz](https://www.cnn.com/2022/03/16/business/starbucks-ceo-howard-schultz/index.html) said in a video [posted to Twitter last week](https://twitter.com/thehoffather/status/1547308330929963008). "This is just the beginning. There are going to be many more."

Starbucks said last week that it is closing 16 stores over safety concerns. Around that time, Debbie Stroud and Denise Nelson, both senior vice presidents of US operations at the company, outlined the efforts that Starbucks is taking to make stores safer in an open letter.

* 

Workers are "seeing firsthand the challenges facing our communities â€” personal safety, racism, lack of access to healthcare, a growing mental health crisis, rising drug use, and more," they wrote, adding that "with stores in thousands of communities across the country, we know these challenges can, at times, play out within our stores too."

* 

The effort to make workers feel safer could result in more closings, according to Schultz's video, which was first reported by [Insider](https://www.businessinsider.com/starbucks-ceo-howard-schultz-says-more-store-closures-are-coming-2022-7).

title: In cases where it
body:
In cases where it isn't able to create a safe environment in a store, Starbucks will close it permanently, the letter continued. In those instances, the company will move employees to neighboring stores.

* 

"One of the primary concerns that our retail partners have is their own personal safety," Schultz said in the video, which was taken during a meeting last week discussing these efforts, according to a spokesperson.

The company also [may close restrooms to the public](https://www.cnn.com/2022/06/10/business-food/howard-schultz-starbucks-bathrooms/index.html), overturning a [2018 policy](https://money.cnn.com/2018/05/20/news/companies/starbucks-bathroom-policy/index.html).

The focus on safety is part of Schultz's broader efforts to revamp the company as it tries to fend off a growing unionization drive.

"We need to reinvent Starbucks for the future," he wrote in an open letter last week, noting that the company must "radically" improve employee experiences. He added that based on feedback from employees, the company will strive to create "safety, welcoming and kindness for our stores."

title: Regarding that store
body:
Regarding that store closure, a company spokesperson said at the time that Starbucks opens and closes stores as part of its regular operations, without offering specific reasons.

"Our local, regional and national leaders have been working with humility, deep care and urgency to create the kind of store environment that partners and customers expect of Starbucks," the Starbucks spokesperson said in June. "Our goal is to ensure that every partner is supported in their individual situation and we have immediate opportunities available in the market."

* 

During its most recent fiscal year, Starbucks closed 424 US company-operated stores, or about 5% of its total, while opening 449 new locations. There are roughly 9,000 company-operated Starbucks stores in the United States.

title: Some efforts are just the harvesting process
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/aBreEPVnM5k_dhwJYhwz9.png?height=270&width=346)

In the vast sea of â€‹â€‹people, there are always people who sigh for the failure of their efforts, and there are always people who feel depressed because they work hard but fail. In fact, life is only a process, come naked, go naked, everyone is the same, just go to the world naked to experience life. The results of all efforts belong only to each station in the life process. It's just that we are all working hard and paying to be as fruitful as possible on the road of life. We set goal after goal and then run toward it, eager to get results, to be successful. Including academic qualifications, diplomas, including money, status, including love, marriage, and social recognition. But not every effort will be rewarded, not every effort can be treated fairly, not every persistence will get what you want, and not every sincerity can be accepted. As a result, some people are in pain, some people are sad, and some people even give up on themselves. Life is ups and downs, if you care about the success or failure of each life site, life will inevitably be tangled and pessimistic. People are often attracted and even shocked by the glory of successful people, but often ignore the failures they have experienced and the bloodstains they once had. The success of a certain life site of the successful person is actually the accumulation of the process. Success does not come from chance, but the necessity of experience. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rK5N_ezZUjz8QUMxuuSUo.png?height=270&width=357)

A long life, some hard work, just the harvesting process. Bill Gates dropped out of Harvard to put his own money into his first business, a program called "Traf-O-Data," which ended in failure. Churchill didn't go to school when he was in sixth grade. Every office he held was a failure. They are well-known and famous, and there have been some efforts without seeing results, but they have become the biggest successes in people's hearts. Don't worry too much about working hard, and don't care too much about the results of your efforts. Correct attitude, the most important thing in life is not a certain result, but the process of life. Just like in a play, knowing that every play will eventually end, the actors in the play still perform very hard. After the performance, whether there is applause or not, the curtain must be drawn. Only the performance is the most important. As long as you work hard and try your best, you will not regret it, and even if you fail, you will not regret it. What you have experienced is part of your life, and it is the accumulation of your future life. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rqyX1uUZQP1-b1cSPIhcq.png?height=266&width=418)

Whether this process is exciting, meaningful and valuable depends entirely on one's own attitude and understanding. I saw a piece of news earlier, Lisa and Alex, the adventurous British couple traveled to 50 countries, changed into local clothes in each country, re-made the bride and groom again, and photographed a fusion of different The photos of the customs and wedding customs allow each country to witness their union and love, and a total of 52 marriages have been married. The hardships they pay are more meaningful in the process and in their own hearts. Give life a happy process, a fulfilling process, more than anything else. Even if you can't dominate the objective environment or change the reality, you must at least learn to dominate your own mind. No matter what the result of your efforts, you can smile and reap the process of your own efforts.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SkDJ5fYGXwCJSTx-IquXx.png?height=270&width=291)

title: Global supply
body:
Global supply chains are still a snarled mess, disrupting deliveries of goods, adding to headaches for businesses and feeding the worldwide surge in inflation.

The good news: There are some indications that the situation is beginning to get better. The bad news: Huge risks â€” from [another spike in coronavirus cases](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/07/08/health/omicron-vaccine-coronavirus-wellness/index.html) to labor disputes involving US rail workers â€” make it difficult to assume much confidence, clouding the outlook for the global economy.

What's happening: The recovery from the pandemic unleashed a wave of demand that manufacturers and the network of players that move items around the world weren't equipped to handle. But after 18 months of pain, there are some signs conditions are starting to improve.

* 

Cargo is flowing more smoothly, and the transit of goods has mostly recovered from the initial shock of the war in Ukraine, Konstantin Krebs, managing partner at Capstan Capital, an investment banking firm that works with investors in containers and container shipping, told me.

* 

"Containers are coming back onstream, and you can feel that," Krebs said.

The [Global Supply Chain Pressure Index](https://www.newyorkfed.org/research/policy/gscpi#/interactive) from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York declined between April and June, though it remains "at historically high levels."

title: meaningful and interesting
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/15GtLEdegSPWltUy4wCJZ.png?height=241&width=436)

There are four kinds of things in the world: things that are meaningful and interesting, things that are meaningless and meaningless, things that are meaningful but meaningless, things that are meaningful but meaningless. The first two are easy to decide, and the latter two are more difficult.
â€‹â€‹
Many units have a fixed half-day business study every week, which is very meaningful and necessary, and is of great benefit to improving skills and enhancing quality. However, because the form is simple and the content is boring, it has become a very boring thing in some units. People try to escape the meeting, or the left ear enters the right ear and the effect is greatly reduced.
â€‹â€‹
Teenagers especially like to play video games, because the form is lively, the content is rich, the pictures are beautiful, and it is very interesting to play. Some children are almost obsessed, forgetting to eat and sleep, day and night, skipping school and skipping school. But this kind of very interesting thing is really meaningless. Indulging in it can only be a waste of life and wasted time.
â€‹â€‹

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jKoTLmsba9Q2KTTadHm4X.png?height=270&width=396)


A happy person is doing something meaningful and interesting. Marx has been doing meaningful and interesting things all his life, forgetting to eat and sleep. Engels' ambition was also to study theories, but in order to make a living, and most importantly, to finance the lives of Marx's family, he had to engage in "boring" business until he entered old age and his life with Marx was guaranteed to a certain extent. He was finally able to devote himself to theoretical research that was both meaningful and interesting in his own eyes, and co-founded the theory of the proletariat with Marx.
â€‹â€‹
The cartoonist Fang Cheng, who is 96 years old this year, was asked the secret of longevity, and the answer was: "I do things I like and meaningful every day." Smart people are good at turning meaningful things into interesting things, and turning boring things into interesting things. Boring things become interesting things. This requires being eclectic, daring to innovate, advancing with the times, and boldly reforming. Learning from Lei Feng is a very meaningful activity, which can cultivate a noble personality and lead the social atmosphere. However, due to the outdated and rigid forms of activities in some places, which are not suitable for the interests and temperaments of young people, this very meaningful thing has become a boring thing. The most exaggerated thing is that on March 5, nearly a dozen students from a nursing home came to learn from Lei Feng, and some elderly people had their feet washed several times a day. In fact, with a lot of brains, learning Lei Feng's activities can be very lively and interesting. For example, making cartoons about Lei Feng's deeds, designing game software that learns from Lei Feng, and composing popular songs about learning from Lei Feng, etc.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0z5hqUFhyzBXvMBwdji5v.png?height=266&width=457)


â€‹â€‹
A philosophical person can adjust himself in time, adjust his interests, adjust his emotions, and turn the originally meaningless things into interesting things. Generally speaking, the meaning of things is objective and will not change, while the meaning of things is subjective and can be cultivated. Shen Congwen originally wrote novels, which was both meaningful and interesting in his mind. However, later on, the situation changed and he had to change his career to study ancient costumes. Although this was a very meaningful thing, it was very uninteresting to him. He got into a new job with the unyielding stubbornness of Hunan people, calmed down, calmed down, and slowly fell in love with clothing research, and eventually became a famous ancient clothing research expert.
â€‹â€‹

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3Ai01-yo-yuhVMJpUBOJ1.png?height=270&width=397)


Life is often faced with choices. If we can choose to do something meaningful and interesting, it is a great blessing in life, and we will never tire of it. If the conditions do not allow it, then you might as well learn from Shen Congwen, do one line of love, one line of excellence, and one line of excellence, so as to turn meaningful and "uninteresting" things into "interesting" things, and then become famous and make life worthwhile. As for those things that are "interesting but meaningless", such as playing video games, as long as you are not addicted to them, you can play them, but you must do so in moderation, so as not to lose your mind and waste your time in "interesting" play. I feel like I've lived a "meaningless" life.

title: Schultz, who
body:
Schultz, who [stepped into the CEO role for the third time in April](https://www.cnn.com/2022/03/29/business/starbucks-leadership-howard-schultz/index.html), has been trying to stave off growing unionization efforts. As of June 24, over 130 stores with more than 3,400 employees have had their unions certified by the National Labor Relations Board, or NLRB. The board has certified decisions against unionization at 15 locations through that date. And dozens of other stores are holding elections.

Union organizers have in the past pointed to store closures as a way to intimidate workers.

in June, Starbucks ([SBUX](https://money.cnn.com/quote/quote.html?symb=SBUX&source=story_quote_link)) workers at an Ithaca, New York, store [claimed their location was being shut down in retaliation for their union activism](https://www.cnn.com/2022/06/05/business/starbucks-ithaca-store-closure/index.html). The worker committee said at the time that it was filing an Unfair Labor Practice charge with the NLRB, alleging that Starbucks was making a "clear attempt to scare workers across the country."

title: Rising infections tied
body:
Rising infections tied to the BA.5 Omicron subvariant could cause another wave of worker shortages and clogged ports, Krebs said. The potential for fresh sanctions on Russia or another round of lockdowns in China also needs to be monitored.

Rail service disruptions are also causing friction at key throughways like the Port of Los Angeles. President Joe Biden last week [took action](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/07/15/business/railroad-strike-threat/index.html) to prevent US railroad workers from going on strike, which would have brought nearly 30% of the nation's freight to a screeching halt, but the clock is ticking for parties to reach a longer-term solution.

A global recession, meanwhile, would reduce pressure dramatically. A plunge in demand would curb supply chain traffic much sooner than expected.

Step back: How quickly supply chains return to normal will have major consequences for inflation, which has been spurred in part by limited access to the supply of goods. Trends will help dictate the path ahead for policymakers like the Federal Reserve.

title: The cost of booking a
body:
The cost of booking a 40-foot shipping container has dropped to nearly $6,400, according to [freight platform Freightos](https://fbx.freightos.com/). At the beginning of the year, it was closer to $9,300 after topping $11,000 last September.

* 

And the Morgan Stanley Business Conditions Index for July, which was released on Monday, revealed "progress in improving supply conditions." The proportion of analysts who said supply chain conditions were on the upswing climbed to 54% from 17%, while none reported a deterioration in conditions.

China [has also been able to handle higher volumes](http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/202207/19/WS62d60ff5a310fd2b29e6d1cc.html) of containers at crucial ports despite restrictions aimed at completely stopping the spread of Covid-19, easing fears that President Xi Jinping's approach to eradicating the virus would significantly exacerbate logjams.

That said: The timeline for a full normalization is still anyone's guess.

According to Morgan Stanley's survey, 54% of respondents believe supply disruptions will subside in the first half of next year, while almost a third think it will take longer.

Boeing ([BA](https://money.cnn.com/quote/quote.html?symb=BA&source=story_quote_link)) CEO Dave Calhoun [said Monday](https://www.cnbc.com/2022/07/18/boeing-ceo-supply-chain-issues-are-hindering-737-max-production-increase.html) that problems with the plane maker's supply chain could persist for another 18 months, hindering its ability to make as many jets as it would like.

Circumstances are still changing quickly, making forecasting even trickier.

title: Tech companies cap hiring as uncertainty looms
body:
### Tech companies cap hiring as uncertainty looms

For much of the past decade, tech companies have showered corporate employees with lavish compensation packages and luxe perks while hiring at a rapid clip. Now, they're [pulling back](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/07/07/tech/tech-layoffs-workers-silicon-valley/index.html), opting for caution as they prepare for a possible recession.

The latest: Bloomberg reported Monday that Apple ([AAPL](https://money.cnn.com/quote/quote.html?symb=AAPL&source=story_quote_link)), the most valuable US company, [intends to slow hiring](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-07-18/apple-joins-fellow-tech-giants-in-putting-a-lid-on-hiring) and spending growth next year in some divisions.

Other tech firms, including Google parent Alphabet, Uber, Lyft, Snap and Twitter have also announced plans to slow or pause hiring.

"Moving forward, we need to be more entrepreneurial, working with greater urgency, sharper focus, and more hunger than we've shown on sunnier days," Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai [said in a memo to employees](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/07/13/tech/google-slowing-hiring/index.html) last week. "In some cases, that means consolidating where investments overlap and streamlining processes."

Investor insight: Apple's stock fell more than 2% on Monday. It's down more than 17% year-to-date. That's slightly better than the broader S&P 500, which is off almost 20% during the same period.

The news puts Wall Street on alert ahead of Big Tech earnings, which kick off in earnest next week. Apple is due to report results on July 28.

The big question: Are tech companies trying to get ahead of a potential drop in economic activity, or are they already seeing signs of a pullback in their businesses?

Apple warned in April that its revenue would take a hit of $4 billion to $8 billion due to ongoing supply chain disruptions. The strong dollar is also expected to be a major headwind.

title: Wall Street's mood is grim. That's not necessarily a bad thing
body:
### Wall Street's mood is grim. That's not necessarily a bad thing

It's no secret that investors have been in a dour mood as concerns about the rapid withdrawal of support from central banks and the growing possibility of a global recession stoke alarm.

But the latest survey of global fund managers from Bank of America, published Tuesday, reveals a "dire level of investor pessimism."

Expectations for global growth are at an all-time low, while levels of cash on hand haven't been this high since September 11. Allocation of money to stocks hasn't been so thin since the 2008 financial crisis.

What it means: To some, this may actually be a signal to start buying risky assets like stocks again. Investors watch for a moment known as "capitulation," when sentiment is so bearish that it can't possibly get any worse. That indicates the bottom of the sell-off could be close.

"Sentiment says stocks/credit rally in coming weeks," said Michael Hartnett, chief investment strategist at Bank of America.

body:
Workers in the [United Kingdom](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/06/06/business/boris-johnson-vote-uk-economy/index.html) are struggling with the [biggest drop in pay](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/07/14/success/pay-raises-inflation/index.html) in more than two decades, as surging food and energy prices take a giant bite out of wages.

Real pay â€” workers' wages that take inflation into account â€” slumped by 2.8% between March and May compared to the same time last year, according to data released Tuesday by the Office for National Statistics.

That's the fastest decline since the ONS began keeping records in 2001.

* 

Earlier this month, UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson resigned after a [series of ethics scandals](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/07/07/europe/boris-johnson-resignation-intl/index.html) proved too costly for the government to brush off. His successor, which is currently being decided, faces a [daunting set of economic and financial challenges](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/07/07/economy/boris-johnson-resignation-economy/index.html).

* 

For months, rising global energy and commodity prices â€” worsened by Russia's invasion of Ukraine â€” have helped stoke [global inflation](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/06/07/economy/janet-yellen-budget-hearing/index.html). The world's fifth-largest economy has been one of the hardest hit among the world's wealthiest nations.

title: Boris Johnson's g
body:
Boris Johnson's government has promised Â£400 ($480) in grants per family to help out the millions of people struggling to pay their energy bills. It also bowed to pressure last month and unveiled a Â£5 billion ($6 billion) tax on the windfall profits of oil and gas companies.

High inflation, combined with damaging Brexit policies have sapped the nation's growth. The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development forecast last month that the UK economy was heading to stagnation, with zero growth in GDP forecast for 2023. That would be the worst performance in the G7 next year.

The pound has also been hammered this year, losing 11% of its value against the US dollar, which will likely make it more expensive to import goods.

* 

But there is one bright spot. Hiring is continuing apace last month, preliminary ONS data showed, with the number of people on payroll growing 3% compared to a year ago.

title: UK consumer prices
body:
UK consumer prices hit a 40-year high of 9.1% in May, the highest among the G7 leading economies â€” and is forecast to climb above 11% later this year despite a series of interest rate hikes.

And households are feeling the strain. Eye-watering energy and grocery bills have thrown Britons into the worst [cost-of-living crisis](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/03/15/business/britain-cost-of-living/index.html) in decades. The Bank of England predicts that disposable incomes will suffer their second biggest decline this year since records began in 1964.

* 

Grocery bill inflation hit nearly 10% in the four weeks ending on July 10, according to data from research firm Kantar released on Tuesday. That means that Britons can expect to spend an additional Â£454 ($545) this year on food and essentials.

[Energy bills](https://edition.cnn.com/2022/02/03/business/energy-prices-uk-cost-of-living/index.html), which rose by 54% in April, are estimated to top Â£3,000 ($3,603) per year for millions of households from October, according to energy research firm Cornwall Insight. That's when the government next adjusts a price cap that limits the amount suppliers can charge customers per unit of energy.

title: Chipotle permanently c
body:
Chipotle permanently closed a restaurant in Augusta, Maine that filed to form a union last month.

"We have been unable to adequately staff this remote restaurant with crew and continue to be plagued with excessive call-outs and lack of availability from existing staff," Laurie Schalow, chief corporate affairs officer at Chipotle ([CMG](https://money.cnn.com/quote/quote.html?symb=CMG&source=story_quote_link)), said in a statement Tuesday, adding that it's been even harder to find managers to lead the restaurant.

"Because of these ongoing staffing challenges, there is no probability of reopening in the foreseeable future, so we've made the decision to permanently close the restaurant," she said.

* 

The restaurant had been closed to the public since June 17, Schalow noted, and was open only for staff trainings. Workers at the location will get severance pay, she said.

* 

The closure has raised alarm bells among union organizers, who accused the chain of trying to stifle workers.

A hearing on whether to proceed with the representation vote was scheduled for Tuesday, according to Jeffrey Young, attorney for Chipotle United, the independent union attempting to organize the Augusta location, but workers learned on Tuesday morning that the store will be shut down for good. The hearing has been postponed indefinitely, Young said.

title: Life is a mirror of the heart
body:
Life is a mirror of the heart, and the appearance of life is actually the state of your heart. When the heart is sunny, life will be bright and bright; when the heart is gloomy, life is often miserable; when the heart is unrestrained, life will never be a pool of stagnant water; when the heart is quiet, life will be peaceful and quiet.
â€‹â€‹

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/cMqcFBlIrqmbu1aoNBIwq.png?height=274&width=444)

Maybe you want to say that the real logic should be that life first creates mentality, not mentality affects life first; maybe you want to count the pressure of work, trivial life, and unsatisfactory life, to help you feel irritable and face. Uncomfortable to solve. In fact, why bother about which came first, the chicken or the egg? As long as you understand, there is no self-reliant woman who walks the red carpet all the way to the other side of success, and there is no successful woman who does not use a smile as a sharp blade to overcome difficulties, and use optimism as an oar to overcome thousands of sails. Life is a polyhedron, but in the season when the cliffs are full of ice, others feel the cold, but they can still laugh at the ice and snow, and they are beautiful.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CSH3kuQVoQsoi6kmjl9P1.png?height=266&width=474)

â€‹â€‹
There are also only two potatoes left, and the optimists are elated: "Oh, that's great, there are still two potatoes that can be roasted and eaten!" The pessimists are dejected: "Hey, there are only two potatoes left, how are things going? Live it!" You give life a happy heart, and those two potatoes are enjoyment; on the other hand, a heart that does not know contentment, two potatoes give you only shabby, poor, and unsatisfactory.
â€‹â€‹

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/R8CTjYt6RrzpBbs6J_u1c.png?height=276&width=442)

Give life a happy heart, and life will give you a brighter sky. In fact, the joy lies in your discovery of all the good things, and it has nothing to do with money power. This requires us to have a pair of eyes to appreciate beauty, but also a heart to experience beauty. It's not so much about a woman's wisdom in managing her life, it's more about a woman's ability and foresight to travel the world happily.
â€‹â€‹
In the years of struggle with shyness and red fists, I am delighted at the husband and wife working hand in hand; in the days when the rice is dipped in oil and salt, I am delighted at the joint growth of children; in the severe winter, when the cold wind is still sharp, I am delighted at being bare. A sprout as big as half a grain of rice sprouted on the branches of the tree; after the wind and rain, after the tree folded and flew, I was delighted at the flexible expression of the grass to the world; after the earthquake of the landslide, I was delighted at the sound of the distant ruins. The sound of the book and the bunch of wild chrysanthemums dripping in a bottle on the window sill...
â€‹â€‹

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mD3oAhoCYNXcLyuPO1LXo.png?height=266&width=402)

Appreciate life with a cheerful heart, and you will find that there are more and more things in life that make you excited. It turns out that it's not that life is unsatisfactory, but that you lost your excited heart in the battle against the mediocre, the ditches, and the misfortunes. Calm down and look at your life, whether the house is messy, whether the spirit is disheveled, and whether the work is helpless. It's the same, get back the feeling of excitement, tidy up the house until it is spotless, clean up the mental garbage and no longer be disheartened, find a breakthrough to overcome the difficulties of the career!
â€‹â€‹
Don't hesitate, give that excited heart to life, and suddenly realize that beauty is actually hidden in the mountains and rivers, and the eyebrows are flying.

title: and said that the co
body:
Workers at a Chipotle in Lansing, Michigan also have filed for a vote, And there are similar efforts underway in Flushing, Queens as well as several other "nascent" efforts, Young said. The closure "sends a message â€” if you try to organize, we'll close your store," he said.

Brandi McNease, who was employed at the Augusta location and has been leading the unionization efforts, said "we're not done" trying to unionize. "We really want to ... tell Chipotle that this isn't going to stand," she said. In June, a letter signed by 10 Augusta employees charged that understaffing and unsafe equipment potentially put the crew and customers at risk, the [Kennebec Journal reported](https://www.centralmaine.com/2022/06/16/augusta-chipotle-workers-walk-out-claim-unsafe-conditions-due-to-understaffing/) at the time.

Chipotle's Schalow said the Augusta store closure had "nothing to do with union activity," and said that the company reviewed the location as it would any other location that had staffing challenges. "Chipotle respects our employees' rights to organize," she said.

The battle comes at a time when a growing number of Starbucks workers have[ formed unions](https://www.cnn.com/2022/03/22/business/starbucks-union-vote-seattle/index.html). Organizers there have also accused the chain of trying to intimidate workers by shuttering locations.

In June, Starbucks workers at an Ithaca, New York, store [claimed their location was being shut down in retaliation](https://www.cnn.com/2022/06/05/business/starbucks-ithaca-store-closure/index.html) for their union activism. The worker committee said at the time that it was filing an Unfair Labor Practice charge with the NLRB, alleging that Starbucks was making a "clear attempt to scare workers across the country." A company spokesperson said at the time that Starbucks opens and closes stores as part of its regular operations, without offering specific reasons.

title: Tiny Bytes: Mechanical Ents
body:
Hello,

Today, I want to take a break from how encryption will break and jump into some world building. One of the ideas that initially got me gong was how could Ents exist but be created by technology. Hereâ€™s the idea:

## Background

Redwoods in California start to die. No one knows why but their bark starts falling off and they become structurally unsound. Eventually the bark that falls off is replaced with artificial bark. 

Initially, the replacement bark just mimics the original bark. It has a rigid structure, gets placed on a tree, and bark grows over it (either by the tree or biological science). Over time the replacement bark gets mode advanced. Sensors are added to monitor the treeâ€™s health and the area around them. Bluetooth/other is used to help the trees communicate locally (or mixed with natures natural ability to communicate). Some trees have the ability to spray liquids to help stop forest fires.

 As we get more data on the trees we begin to understand them more. Analyzing that data and combining it with NLP allows use to see the treesâ€™ thoughts. We learn to talk back to the trees. The bark can send signals to the trees. Also, at this point, most of nature is some combination of tree/bacteria (currently exist) and devices with AI/introduced support organisms (future introductions). Communicating we have subtle ways to communicate with each -- i.e., communicate with the tree. This allows a type of two way conversation with trees. 

With conversation comes novelty. Some trees are given a set of mechanical eyes and a mouth. Some are a novelty and others are for convenience (the trees can also communicate with personal electronics). Of course, different areas debate different rules about communicating with trees. 

Different implementations, policies, changes of human movements, and different amounts of care lead to different outcomes for trees. Some treeâ€™s artificial bark no longer looks like bark but just metal. Some have movement and can sway to the light. Some have the ability to move by their roots to make relocating trees easier. 

## Imagined Conversation

Hi Tree, how are you?

The soil is dry and it has not rained. I am thirsty. The whole valley is like this. Is that why you are here?

No, I am here to see the views.

The views are quite pretty. I hope they last.  
      There is trash near my roots. Could you please pick it up?

(not sure what tree personalities are yet) 

## Ecosystem

(This will take much more work)

Different trees will take different amounts of human involvement to survive. However, as time goes on the ecosystem needs to support these trees. There has to be bacteria/organisms that help recycle the parts on the trees. They last a while but there needs to be something. There also has to be a way that the artificial bark lasts for many, many years.

I also imagine that the tree seeds eventually are supported by some kind of technology. The seeds can be fragile and helping the seed grow + get sensors is important.

Thatâ€™s the quick idea for now. I also thought about if I wanted to live in this world. If technology touches everything is that a good world? Iâ€™m not sure. I DO want there to be systems that exist without human help (fully automated). What happens to an ecosystem built on technology is is self sufficient and humans leave? What happens if IT NEEDS humans and they leave? 

Night,

Lucas

body:
"Very nice place to ride a bike," Shawn Ruby [wrote](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Brandon+Falls/@39.3744253,-163.6405777,3z/data=!4m11!1m2!2m1!1sbrandon+falls!3m7!1s0x89b8b7a65a6a53df:0x6183b14f932bc3d0!8m2!3d38.7416594!4d-75.0818488!9m1!1b1!15sCg1icmFuZG9uIGZhbGxzkgETaGlzdG9yaWNhbF9sYW5kbWFyaw) in a Google Maps review of the location. "Just be careful not to cause too much inflation in your tires or you can end up crashing your whole bike into the ground. But if that happens, just blame Putin. People will 'fall' for it!"

Other reviews also similarly criticized the president, with Carl O'Donoghue writing: "Biden's face-plant into the concrete while riding his bike is the perfect analogy for the U.S. economy that he's been steering into the ground."

[Snopes](https://www.snopes.com/news/2022/07/19/biden-brandon-falls/) was inclined to note, actually, "Brandon Falls" is not an official landmark named by the state. Google Maps permits any user to create a public landmark, which means that someone established and named the site.

The social media account that created "Brandon Falls" recently encouraged the trend of "Bidening" â€” intentionally falling off a bike at the site, taking a photograph or video of the crash, and then posting it online, according to Snopes.

Reddude was an introvert as a child and had few friends. After school every day, he stayed in the small garden in the backyard, observing the flowers and plants. Reddude had a strong interest in drawing since he was a child, so he started to draw all kinds of roses.

title: The sale, which Sotheby's
body:
The sale, which Sotheby's has titled "Buzz Aldrin: American Icon," will take place on July 26, less than a week after the moon landing's 53rd anniversary.

The auction house's global head of science and popular culture, Cassandra Hatton, described the collection as "the reflection of a man of incredible strength and drive, a man who has faced times of adversity with determination and perseverance, and who remained logical and level-headed, even in moments of great peril."

[Original Buzz Aldrin moon walk photo sells for $7,700 at auction](https://edition.cnn.com/style/article/moon-walk-apollo-photo-auction-scn/index.html)

Another notable lot from the Apollo 11 mission is a systems activation checklist, containing diagrams and flight data, which Aldrin was supposed to discard on the moon's surface. Sotheby's estimated that the manuscript will sell for between $150,000 and $250,000.

Elsewhere in the sale is a hand-stitched banner reading "Go Army Beat Navy" -- a reference to the annual Army-Navy football game -- that Aldrin unveiled on spacewalks during 1966's Gemini 12 mission. The item is expected to fetch $20,000 to $30,000.

title: There is a universe in play
body:
What kid doesn't like to play? But it is true that playing can be divided into those who can play and those who do not, and the difference between the two is still very large.
â€‹â€‹
A graduate of the Department of Architecture of Tsinghua University named Huang Hui, recently wrote an article ""Old Partner" Liang Sicheng" to recall the student life in those years, as well as the kind "old partner" Liang Sicheng's bit by bit of teaching and advice to him. influences.
â€‹â€‹
When talking about learning and playing, the author recalled that in the final exam of the sophomore year, more than half of the students in the class failed in material mechanics.
â€‹â€‹
This is really embarrassing, and everyone starts to summarize the reasons and lessons. After some people wanted to understand, they reported to the teacher that the author at that time often gathered seven or eight classmates to ride into the city to watch performances and football games, and did not go to self-study at night, which had a very bad influence.
â€‹â€‹

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PBezftw1v1Dze8PJQ4_1D.png?height=266&width=430)


The teacher was a little angry. He found Huang Hui, who took the lead in playing crazy, and severely criticized him. But he was very unconvinced. For a while, he thought how could he have such great ability to influence more than half of his classmates. For a while, is it a deadly enemy to play and learn? A nerd who doesn't know how to play is useless in the future, no matter how good the exam is. Thinking of this, he talked back to the teacher.
â€‹â€‹
At this time, the head of the department, Mr. Liang Sicheng, summoned the author. He was anxiously waiting for a possibly extremely severe criticism, and he did not want to make things worse.
â€‹â€‹
When Mr. Liang criticized Huang Hui, he really had a serious face and severely criticized him for not following the discipline. The author liked and respected Mr. Liang at the time, and silently accepted the teacher's instruction, and was about to leave when the other party stopped him again, and said to him with a smile:
â€‹â€‹
"Just now, Liang Sicheng, the head of the Department of Architecture, was talking to you, and you must implement my opinion; here is the little old man Liang Sicheng and you discussing the issue of 'playing', you can listen to it or not. In fact, 'playing' is a good thing, learning architecture People who play more and have more knowledge, but they must be able to play, not foolishly.â€

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vRMi3--Da-PwTRF8dYVpq.png?height=266&width=435)


â€‹â€‹
This remark was greatly beyond the author's expectations. Mr. Liang actually affirmed "playing", which means that it is not wrong to take seven or eight classmates out to play, but the teacher thinks that they can't play. Isn't playing "stupid"? Are you happy and relaxed? If it's a serious thing to play, what's the energy and meaning of it?
â€‹â€‹
Of course, the teacher saw the doubt in his eyes, and then told him about his experiences in sports and literature and art when he was young. Those experiences were really wonderful, not inferior to theirs. The author secretly admired it, and listened more relaxedly and attentively. Finally, Mr. Liang Sicheng told Huang Hui:
â€‹â€‹
"When people in sports teams design a stadium track, they don't ignore the slope of the track and the buffer lane after sprints; when people in choirs design a concert hall, they don't ignore the sound quality of the back seats. Their design concept It is different from the depth of people who have no interest in style. But if you just play stupidly, if you donâ€™t read it, or donâ€™t want to, then itâ€™s called play for nothing. When you play, you have to consider your surroundings, look around, think about how you would deal with this design if you did it ? To play, not to be a nerd."

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uN_PGoPMow1z1DHXwTMv4.png?height=266&width=417)


â€‹â€‹
Mr. Liang's lively and simple words and deeds completely convinced the author. It turns out that foolish play is nothing to play, which is really a big loss. The teacher does not want nerds who can't play and can only chew on books, because the future design of nerds will definitely be Those who don't "know people", or that kind of nerds just design for the books they have read and themselves, not for others, and even bring about the consequences of laboring the people and hurting the money, and then the loss will be even worse. There are heaven and earth in the game, and there are hidden dangers in the game. "Little old man" and "old friend" Mr. Liang's far-reaching intentions turned out to be here, and how sincere he speaks, it is moving and admirable.
â€‹â€‹
Huang Hui said affectionately in the article: "When I think about it now, every bit by bit during the six years of getting along has affected my life principles and habits of doing things, and unknowingly paved the way for our dedication."

title: Blue Soul  Manual
body:
`Brief Intrduction:`

1. Olandbox Blue Soul is a functional development based on the original land mint of olandbox. As a linktree in the web3 world, it currently has the functions of personal information integration and link aggregation, and will open more functional modules in the future.
2. According to the basic division of land, the corresponding areas will be divided into public space, official space, and private space. Currently, Blue Soul will first be deployed in the official space.
3. The main function division of Blue Soul will be divided into official space editing content,  links, combined with land use to form a map.

   Next is the how-to guide for Blue Soul: 
 

   ### Part One:.Enter the plandbox official website and click on the Blue Soul navigation bar.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Tszw158-7EfCMwc2cUj-i.jpg?height=1414&width=826)

1. Take the mobile terminal as an example, log in to the wallet and switch the polygon network.

   And if you are i the test internet, please switch your internet to the mumbai:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xt2YA0zq2v6ge86dYhy6W.jpg?height=693&width=418)

* 1. Enter the personal page, you will see the content under the oï»¿fï»¿fï»¿iï»¿cï»¿iï»¿aï»¿lï»¿ ï»¿page, ï»¿slide down, there will be personal information my land page.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SN0PLnVPuKDpFjdZmA7ZW.jpg?height=1283&width=561)

* 2.Click on the Personal information to edit.

### Part Two: Customize the editing content

1. Click on the personal information page,ï»¿ there will be three navigation bars - ï»¿basic information, link and mapping management.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Pr1RLUCFp9CfmBFloxNHG.jpg?height=1649&width=826)

`a. Click basic information, add custom avatar and personal introduction.`

(The show button can be opened by choice. If you want this information to be displayed on the main page, you can open this button.)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/e9jAnIyLcAqyDz6sjhAJh.jpg?height=1643&width=826)

`b. Click link to navigate the page, the following display will appear.`

There are currently 6 commonly used apps to choose from, you can also click 'Add New Relation' to customize the APP icon and related links.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3vIAnkrL7HVl_JGTEIA9l.jpg?height=1287&width=562)

For example: I want to share my account on Twitter, just upload my username on Twitter and a link to the corresponding personal page.

Olandboxï¼š

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rU2B17qfZ5Bq-wSD9ZfV2.jpg?height=1421&width=498)

`c. Mapping Management`

Mapping management is based on the first two custom information, combined with the land held by your olandbox, to form the domain name mapping. Because the land can be customized, to a certain extent, it also shows that if you own the land, the domain name where your personal information is aggregated can also be customized. It doesn't matter if you don't have land, you can still use the Blue Soul information aggregation function.

**i Information aggregation without land:**

Directly click the corresponding link, share it where you want to share, and click to display your personal information and related corresponding links.

Link example: <https://test.mint.oland.info/detail/null.v>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/E2pHOqhdAZy-6Xn1GAA-A.jpg?height=1422&width=826)

**ii Aggregation of land ownership information:**

Mint the land you want in advance, and refer to the land mint guide for details. Owned land can also be viewed in My Land on the personal page. 
 

Click the corresponding link, share it where you want to share, and click to display your personal information and related corresponding links. (mint multiple lands, and the corresponding mapping information of multiple lands is my corresponding information.)

eg: ï»¿<https://test.mint.oland.info/detail/ipadfrtyyu.o>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uh839lOgfAoTbi92gVJAt.jpg?height=1422&width=826)

`Examples of finished product display:`

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ild8EH8CJ28g0oM_9ullF.jpg?height=1489&width=827)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2ujJBz0WPscZgFPQNBHt0.jpg?height=1321&width=827)

### Part Three: Practical operation - share link

1. **Click the share link, click the link to open the personal profile**

eg:<https://test.mint.oland.info/detail/ipadfrtyyu.o>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kQmNIGLsyU_6mdmNRhVc-.jpg?height=1437&width=828)

**2.Click'View Details' in profile,  then it will jump to personal land page.**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/DNTJw1Z6Ay-r2UgheJmvM.jpg?height=1441&width=827)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/L0d1PA5ksnW4hYp5aMCM-.jpg?height=1114&width=565)

**3.Turn off the display in the personal land, so the content of the land will no longer display in the profile.**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/aJcBt57ny5bsBa-LxvYGm.jpg?height=1437&width=826)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/bZWYaysEdmrX2uM1FC3Ef.jpg?height=1641&width=826)

**4.Domain name mapping is closed and cannot be accessed through the previous link.**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/E5u1yiToeO0gkr4ya6J_y.jpg?height=1437&width=826)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9jkCYYmPxpmEz69k-WXAw.jpg?height=1284&width=826)

title: A fireside chat with Re7 Capital & PWN
body:
### In our latest Twitter Spaces session, we joined forces with Evgeny of Re7 Capital. Join us as we look back on a great fireside chat that spanned a range of topics, from Evgenyâ€™s experience using PWN to the best security practices in DeFi and the future of NFTs.

### Introduction

Steve and [Evgeny](https://twitter.com/evgeny_re7) first met about a year ago, when Evgeny reached out to Steve after both took part in a call together with some folks from [MetaCartel](https://twitter.com/Meta_Cartel). Theyâ€™ve stayed in touch since then, and just recently, our team has been in touch with Evgeny about a [super exciting Nouns NFT loan](https://twitter.com/pwndao/status/1547854897478963200?s=20&t=Av67GzoUdR5v21bQt1x1Sg) worth $60K thatâ€™s currently backed on the PWN platform. Through this process, Evgeny had a chance to get up and personal with our platform.

### What does Re7 Capital think of the PWN platform?

Evgeny was one of the first people to use the recently released version of the [PWN protocol and platform](https://app.pwn.xyz/#/). So what was his experience like while using it?

* **Great UX and UI**: Evgeny mentioned that using PWN is smooth and the process is super straightforward. Heâ€™s a fan of our clean UI (and enjoys our simple yet aesthetically pleasing color palette)!
* **Verification made easy**: Using PWN, itâ€™s easy to cross-check assets on OpenSea. This is because we include an asset explorer link (such as Opensea) directly on a loanâ€™s detail page. [Visit PWN](https://pwn.xyz/) to learn more.

### All about the Nouns deal

[Our first Nouns NFT loan](https://twitter.com/pwndao/status/1547854897478963200?s=20&t=Av67GzoUdR5v21bQt1x1Sg) is a big deal.

Weâ€™re extra excited about it, since there are only 374 Nouns in existence with a floor price of 108 ETH (roughly $115,560) per NFT. Around 10,000 Nouns are estimated to be around in the late 2040s, so thereâ€™s currently less potential sell pressure and buyers are closely involved through proposals and the nounification of the NFT landscape.

The Nouns community is one of the most active communities out there, and they actively manage their treasury. What makes this community really stand out is how well-structured it is as well as the fact that the team is composed of real DeFi professionals.

Nounsâ€™ average price has been going up over the last \~120 days, with an average 90-day price of 96 ETH and a 90-day volume of 2,807 ETH. Nouns DAO has implemented some best practices of other blue-chip PFP projects â€“ theyâ€™re CC0 and they have been innovating with funding mechanisms.

When using the platform, PWN users donâ€™t need to worry about owning an NFT worth 100 ETH. Since PWN is deployed on Polygon, network fees wonâ€™t be a problem for NFTs with a smaller value. [Check out the PWN platform for yourself](https://app.pwn.xyz/#/)!

### Steveâ€™s questions for Re7

A large segment of our fireside chat with [Re7](https://twitter.com/Re7Capital) was spent discussing some hot topics in a Q&A session. Weâ€™ll sum up some of the questions that Steve had for Evgeny.

**How do you check that youâ€™re interacting with the right contract?**

Re7 carries out dozens of on-chain transactions every day and has been doing so for a year. In the teamâ€™s day-to-day activities, maintaining security is a top priority. â€Itâ€™s really easy to lose money on the blockchain if youâ€™re not carefulâ€, said Evgeny. â€œItâ€™s really important to double check everything youâ€™re doing.â€

Evgeny emphasized the ongoing need to keep oneâ€™s security in check while mentioning a few notable industry vulnerabilities, such as the exploits affecting [Convex](https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2022/06/24/convex-finance-sets-up-new-urls-after-website-address-is-hijacked/), [Harmony](https://decrypt.co/104138/north-korean-attackers-behind-100m-harmony-hack-report), and [Solanaâ€™s Wormhole](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2022/02/03/solanas-sol-tumbles-10-after-326m-wormhole-exploit/).

A couple pieces of advice to stay on top of oneâ€™s security are as follows: Always be sure to [verify contract addresses on Etherscan](https://info.etherscan.com/how-to-verify-address-ownership/#:\~:text=Step%201%3A%20Upon%20clicking%20on,able%20to%20sign%20the%20message.) and check that any collateral is really what you think it is.

**Do you proactively revoke approvals that you think you wonâ€™t be using in the future?**

The Re7 team finds it the most efficient to carry out periodic reviews. â€œThe reality is that if youâ€™re doing this all the time, it can become painful,â€ said Evgeny. In order to bolster security, they also make use of many different wallets â€” that way, if someone gets unlucky, theyâ€™re able to contain the damage.

**Do you get a lot of scammy content in your DMs?**

Re7 receives *a lot* of scammy messages on their channels. As a rule of thumb, the only people who they respond to and communicate with are those who they actively know. Otherwise, they choose to block other DMs, around five to seven of which they receive daily on Twitter.

Evgenyâ€™s advice: If you get a message from someone you donâ€™t know asking for information and/or help, itâ€™s best to assume itâ€™s a scam until proven otherwise

**How does Re7 Capital evaluate risks when investing? Has the playbook changed in any way now that weâ€™re in a bear market?**

Evgeny pointed out the importance of distinguishing between real risk and the perception of risk. He compared dealings within DeFi with the oft-cited quote, â€œIf you're not paying for the product, you are the product.â€ He commented that thereâ€™s a similar result in DeFi; in other words, â€œIf you donâ€™t know where the yield is coming from, youâ€™re the yield.â€

In regards to the current state of the market, Re7 sees how the perception of risk has affected how people manage their money. Because liquidity has dried up, the playbook has changed and is currently evolving at a rapid pace.

### Thoughts on DAOs

As the conversation turned to the topic of DAOs, Evgeny went over a few key facts about Re7â€™s organizational structure: Re7 has its own investment fund, and Evgeny is a part of MetaCartel. The company is fully regulated and compliant in what they do, which ultimately protects them as a business. Re7 decided against moving to a DAO, but in general, they feel that certain organizational structures are relevant for a companyâ€™s respective use case.

According to Evgeny, investment teams can either choose to be very open or opt for efficiency over openness. His teamâ€™s experience has demonstrated that communication in a more closed environment allows for making decisions instantly.

### Final reflections

Two things that Evgeny is excited about looking ahead are NFTs and the metaverse. He was curious how the PWN team envisions the future of NFTs.

As Steve put it, â€œWe need to see a proper marriage between NFTs and the DeFi ecosystemâ€. He recently dove into the importance of this topic during a talk on how to onboard a billion DeFi users (more on that in [our recent monthly digest](https://pwn.mirror.xyz/I6TjFg0MVUZx542XnKzsZDs1P4UzrOtrRk86a4i6lYQ)).

In the next six months, PWN will be able to do things with NFTs that web2 has never even dreamed of â€” so stay tuned! For now, [check out the platform](https://app.pwn.xyz/#/) to:

* See how much others are willing to lend
* Check out the loans available at the moment
* See other NFT collections that are currently listed
* â€¦and more!

[Follow us on Twitter](https://twitter.com/PWNFinance) to stay as up to date as possible on our teamâ€™s daily activities.


---

**A massive thank you to Evgeny and Re7 Capital for teaming up with us for this session. Weâ€™re excited to see where things continue to take us together.**

title: What Is Mintted.io And Whatâ€™s In It For You
body:
Mintted is designed to **solve problems creators** face with social media platforms including:

* **Criticism** and **harassment**.
* Constant **algorithm** changes.
* Getting **paid fairly** for their work.
* Much more (see [our full list of problems and solutions](https://mirror.xyz/0xF1650d925DFfC086aC720ca976DD01542A7f528d/0x3dusSKADSRlfUuPVNDMnq0qJU21FfVnixXTc7u0z0)).

We help creators tokenize their communities by turning fans into sponsors. This way, creators can **convert their social capital into financial capital**, and get direct support from their fans instead of relying on external social platforms. We do this using the power of **social tokens**.

## What Are Social Tokens?

Simply put, tokens represent **ownership** or **access rights** to something. In the case of social tokens, theyâ€™re backed by the reputation of an individual, a brand, or a community.

Using social tokens, **fans and communities** can become **part-owners** of a creatorâ€™s brand (for a deeper dive on how this works, check out our article [What Are Social Tokens?](https://mirror.xyz/0xF1650d925DFfC086aC720ca976DD01542A7f528d/Fz6uyY_VTECWTlKMyxGFcECNwN-ks3cDW7wXoW972a4)).

Social tokens have many **benefits for creators**, including:

* They **don't depend** on third-party rules, which gives you more **control** over your content, community, and your relationship with fans.
* Fans can buy, sell or trade your token, which lets your most hardcore fans **participate** in your success.
* They **foster** an engaged community with aligned interests (because everyone has a stake in your token).

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dB_H-SFJyOos9BXPSV5x2.png?height=1080&width=1920)

## Why Choose Mintted?

### Easy for fans & creators

To help as many creators as possible, we built a social coin platform thatâ€™s **easy to use and understand**. When you join Mintted, your fans will be able to support you by buying your social coin with **credit cards**.

### The Power of Fan Tiers

Using our **Fan Tier System**, you can set the access level your fans will have to your community based on their **level of engagement** (amount of coins purchased). The more coins fans have, the more benefits they receive in the form of special perks, exclusive content, etc. You as the creator also get to decide what these benefits are: In-person meetings? One-on-one Zoom calls? Group coaching? Access to courses or trainings? **The possibilities are endless**!

### Creating Real Value

Your social coin will have **real value** inside your community. This is a huge upgrade compared to social media, where your content is often only rewarded with free likes and follows. Fans can **hold** your coin to preserve their fan tier status, or they can **purchase** more to unlock certain benefits. Fans can also **redeem** coins for special utilities (coming soon) or sell them for their current market value to other fans.

### Get the Highest Payout in the Creator Economy

As a creator on Mintted, youâ€™ll **keep 80% of the coin sales** + a **fee** from every **transaction**. Plus, there are no upfront costs or hidden add-on charges to tokenize your community on Mintted. Getting started is **free**.

### Great for Fans, Too

Mintted is equally great for your fans. Theyâ€™ll be able to easily support you and get exclusive access to special perks and benefits that are exclusive to community members, and not available on other platforms. Itâ€™s as simple as **purchasing your social coin** using their credit card. On Mintted, everybody wins.

To see how other creators are using these unique features and tokenizing their community, check out our beta app [here](https://mintt.me/mintted_app).

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dgMD2ZwOAbiopM-jCCDgV.png?height=1080&width=1920)

## Tokenize Your Community

**Mintted exists for you**. To help you turn your influence and social capital into financial value. To help you liberate yourself from social media regulations, brand dependency, algorithm anxiety, and monetization struggles.

Mintted is where **true creative freedom begins**. Build a closer relationship with your fans by turning them into valued partners. [Tokenize your community](https://mintt.me/waitlist) with Mintted today.

title: P2E Games: why it's so dull and two rules to strike gold in P2E game building.
body:
# Intro

Some might know who we are, and some won't. So I will start with a brief introduction to our DAVA project. What we have built, how far along are we, our philosophies, and the direction we are going.Â 

### DAVA project: the Genesis

So, in the beginning, the DAVA project started as an on-chain, fully customizable avatar NFT project. Foremost, we created a protocol that enables a base NFT, DAVA humanoids, to wear other validated NFTs, one of which is the DAVA wearables collection. The protocol is fully functioning on Polygon. As a result, DAVA holders can use DAVA avatars just like in real life: you buy clothes, equip them, and express who you are, anywhere, anytime.Â 

![DAVA: on-chain, fully customizable avatar NFT project, on Polygon](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CR31yh2G6J_Z-b3-Kle0v.png?height=405&width=933)

### DAVA project: the Thinker of Utility

Using our outstanding technical advantages, we were constantly questioning the ''utility'' of an NFT. Some might say it's to show your social status passively, and others say membership to enter an exclusive community. I agree in most parts, but we, as project builders, felt the need to find something more exciting; Something that tingles your stomach as a crypto investor; Something that can change the world. A grand mission that we, as project builders, can devote our lives to build.Â 

### DAVA project: the Birth of DAVA Game

So long story short, we concluded that we needed an enjoyable virtual world that allows network effects to kick in. Hence, we decided to build a game protocol where validated and non-validated NFTs can permissionlessly enter and leave seamlessly. A virtual world with a working economy that functions. People would freely conduct social activities through the interface of a game and get economic rewards by adding the network value.Â 

![game protocol where validated and non-validated NFTs can permissionlessly enter](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XlOPW6Uc8v6SxcPdrkFrw.png?height=521&width=919)

Our closed beta is going to launch in September. A few weeks from now, around the Korean Blockchain Week, we will release a lot of exciting information about our game. Follow us on Twitter and discord for more details. You can always hit me up on Twitter; I go by Blocksage or Jimmy.Â 

# Why it's so boring and the future of the DAVA game.

I think the question drills down to one answer. It is effortless to adapt ill-designed tokenomics to P2E games. Previously, anyone would build a shitty game in a new Layer 1 chain and throw in some tokens to solve the ''cold start problem.'' But, then, BAMM; the founders, are millionaires. So regardless of the team's intentions, it was against the builder's incentive to build a thoroughly thought out, appropriate P2E game that is fun.Â 

A famous quote, "people get the government they deserve," also applies to the crypto market. Likewise, web3 consumers get the builders they deserve. I genuinely believe that the tipping point for the moment when P2E games become fun is inevitable. This moment will only happen when all of you agree that a game's network value solely depends on how much ''fun'' the game provides, excluding the fun of earning.

So this in mind, our closed beta's sole purpose is to test our game's ''funness.'' Players can play our game with or without any web3 wallets. DAVA holders and non-holders will have no in-game unfairness, yet DAVA holders will financially benefit as our game increases its network value. For my gamer audiences, the game will be rouge-like with deck-building strategies.Â 

### So then, how can you build a well-designed tokenomics for P2E games?

This is a long topic, so let me elaborate in a separate blog. But our first two rules of them are following:Â 

1. Passive participants (NFT owners) should increase the value of the network by providing some utility to the active participants. Financial benefit should come depending on the value it provides.Â 
2. The tokens obtained by active participants should be directly related to increasing the value of the network. Simply grinding time does not apply.Â 

With the two rules above applied to a simple game, you will strike gold just like that.

### Is there any effort in marketing/ongoing development to attract more active users and increase user stickiness?

Our current short-term primary mission is to build a fun blockchain game. All our development resources are used to create a sustainable blockchain game. Our marketing campaigns will kick off after the Korean blockchain week with detailed tokenomics, whitepaper, and new revamped landing pages.Â 

### Are there any partnerships you are looking for, and what kind of standard do you guys have?

We are looking for partners, advisors, and supporters who agree and empathize with our core values: games should be fun, and P2E tokenomics should value individuals who put value into the network. Ways of collaboration are almost infinite, and we are open. Feel free to contact me or the DAVA project.Â 

# Do you want to talk more about this topic?

Are you interested in DAVA and what we are building? Do you feel resonance with our vision and philosophies? Check out and reach me on Twitter. I would love to hear your opinions.Â
