title: Tolerance triumphs over hatred
body:
Shakespeare once said: "There is an angel and a devil in everyone's heart, and the outcome of the battle determines whether you are an angel or a devil." The so-called thinking of heaven and hell, when a person holds power, can decide When a person dies, whether he chooses tolerance or slaughter, it reflects whether an angel or a devil lives in his heart. Whoever your heart is inclined towards, whoever you will become.
â€‹â€‹

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/O5xgdFNPfOYf-Ld9c1y5B.png?height=270&width=373)

 If we can't use our own wisdom to eliminate our own greed, arrogance and arrogance, then we will always be only weak. Sherlock in Shakespeare's The Merchant of Venice is a man full of conquest. Because of his hatred of Antonio, he took the opportunity to lend Antonio money to enter into a "debt-cutting flesh" agreement with him. When Antonio was unable to pay his debts due to an accident, he made sure to cut a pound of flesh off Antonio's chest. When the duke persuaded him to be merciful, he ignored it; when Bassanio offered to pay him ten times as much, Sherlock went his own way. Sherlock's hatred overwhelmed his tolerance, and he turned his power into a murderous sword. He used his greed, hatred and arrogance to kill others when others were powerless to fight back. At that moment, Sherlock was the devil. However, at the end of the play, when Sherlock was sentenced to death and deprived of his property for attempting to kill, he knelt down and begged for mercy, just for the forgiveness of others. The real power is never to use the power in your hands to create momentum for your own selfish desires.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xf3dkL9MFu1pV-RwMnqat.png?height=270&width=252)

 â€‹â€‹Portia famously said when persuading Sherlock: "Forgiveness is like the rain of tenderness falling from the sky to the world, it benefits both parties - the one who gives and the one who receives it, and it is the noblest of all virtues on earth. "In the game of hatred and tolerance, Portia, the Duke and Antonio are all angels, and it is impossible for them to have no hatred for Sherlock. However, when they defeated Sherlock with wisdom, their inner tolerance also defeated hatred, just as The Duke said: "You are not worthy of our tolerance. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WFCg_nn7Ir5kVhR8UXqh6.png?height=270&width=394)

How can people who have no tolerance hope for the tolerance of others? But we will let you know that we have a different spirit from you." They let go of Sherlock, who should be beheaded , they use the tolerance in their hearts to leave a ray of life for others. â€‹â€‹ What is power? Power is when we have the ability to destroy something, we choose tolerance. â€‹â€‹ An Italian female explorer crossed the Taklimakan Desert alone. When she walked out of the desert, she knelt down facing the desert and was silent for a long time. A reporter asked her why she knelt after conquering the desert. She said: "I don't think I conquered the desert, I am grateful that the desert allowed me to pass." Lao Tzu said: "The one who conquers others is stronger, and the one who conquers oneself is stronger." Conquering others with strength only shows that you are strong and powerful, and you rely on tolerance. Those who overcome themselves with self-discipline are truly strong.

title: I Fell Again
body:
\~I fell Again\~

So, I fell again,
in the dirt, on the mat,
with wind knocked out of my lungs.
This feels like,
I may never get up again.
My head hurts,
there is blood on my clothes,
mouth swollen, canâ€™t speak,
vision blurryâ€¦ and
I feel hollow.
Meanwhile,
Everyone around me,
laughing, pointing, doubting and
betting against me.

Soâ€¦.
I close my eyes, grind my teeth,
suck in air full of filth and
foul smell.
Push pain, fear and shame,
out of my mind.
Focus,
on that one thing, one person,
who loves me the most,
believes in me and
sees me, the REAL me.

So, I rise again,
in the dirt, on the mat.
One more time I think,
One more punch I say.

title: choose the right direction
body:
In the early 1920s, Ken Levin, a member of the Royal Academy of Sciences, led his elite team to conduct a scientific expedition in the hinterland of the Sahara Desert. After three days and nights of travel, they finally arrived at their destination.
â€‹â€‹
What surprised them was that there was an oasis of 15 square kilometers. There was a small village called Bissell in the oasis. The villagers were self-sufficient and never left here for generations.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uFSXAsrs8AUG7BapQo47P.png?height=266&width=474)


â€‹â€‹
In recent years, they were forced by their living conditions and tried to leave the land again and again, but no matter which direction they walked, they finally returned to the same place again and again, which made them deeply confused.
â€‹â€‹
When Ken Levin learned about this situation, he became very interested and decided to reveal the mystery that has puzzled the villagers for thousands of years.
â€‹â€‹
The next day, Ken Levin put away his compass and other navigation tools, hired two Bissells, and asked them to lead the way, trying to see why they couldn't get out of the desert. They prepared enough water and food for half a month, brought two camels, and started on the road.
â€‹â€‹
After 10 days, they had walked about 800 miles and still had not made it out of the desert. On the morning of the eleventh day, the familiar little oasis appeared before them, and they returned to Bissell.
â€‹â€‹
At this time, Ken Levin finally revealed the mystery - the reason why the Bissells could not walk out of the desert was because they did not have a compass and did not know the Big Dipper. You must know that the two legs of all normal people are not absolutely equal. When walking in the endless desert by feeling, they will definitely walk in many circles, big and small, while Bissell is in the desert hinterland with a radius of thousands of kilometers. Compass, and they don't know the Big Dipper, their last footprints are likely to be in the shape of a tape measure, and eventually return to the starting point.
â€‹â€‹
After that, Ken Levine taught the Bissells to know the Big Dipper. Following the direction of the Big Dipper, they walked out of the desert in only three days.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/veO6ykDxf_lxNHvRAFPaT.png?height=270&width=402)


â€‹â€‹
Back at the Royal Academy of Sciences, Professor Ken Levine told his students about this personal experience in class. In the end, he said that many times, we are misunderstood by ability and perseverance, thinking that as long as we are diligent and persistent, we will succeed. Success, in fact, in the struggle, it is far from enough to rely on ability, determination and hard work. If you don't choose the right direction for success, no matter how good your wishes will be, you will be in vain.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ueOhzhuFYqvS6CQtxYXuZ.png?height=270&width=405)

title: Proper Job Placement
body:
Methods from Human Resources...

1. Put 400 bricks in a closed room.
2. Put your new hires in the room and close the door.
3. Leave them alone and come back after 6 hours.
4. Then analyze1 the situation:

a. If they are counting the bricks, put them in the Accounting2 Department.

b. If they are recounting them, put them in Auditing3.

c. If they have messed up the whole place with the bricks, put them in Engineering.

d. If they are arranging the bricks in some strange order, put them in Planning.

e. If they are throwing the bricks at each other, put them in Operations.

f. If they are sleeping, put them in Security.

g. If they have broken the bricks into pieces, put them in Information Technology.

h. If they are sitting idle, put them in Human Resources.

i. If they say they have tried different combinations, they are looking for more, yet not a brick has been moved, put them in Sales.

j. If they have already left for the day, put them in Management.

k. If they are staring out of the window, put them in Strategic Planning.

l. If they are talking to each other, and not a single brick has been moved, congratulate them and put them in Top Management.

m. Finally, if they have surrounded themselves with bricks in such a way that they can neither be seen nor heard from, put them in Congress.
